commit_message:
Cache fragment size for EC policy

ECStoragePolicy.fragment_size is never changed on running Swift because
it is from ec_segment_size and ec_type defined in swift.conf statically
so let's cache the value after retrieving the value from the pyeclib driver.

And more, pyeclib <= 1.2.1 (current newest) has a bug [1] to leak the reference
count of the items in the returned dict (i.e. causes memory leak) so that
this caching will be mitigation of the memory leak because this saves the call
count fewer than current as possible.

Note that the complete fix for the memory leak for pyeclib is proposed at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344066/

1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/pyeclib/+bug/1604335

Related-Bug: #1604335
Change-Id: I6bbaa4063dc462383c949764b6567b2bee233689

commit_message:
[Tempest] Create heavy scenario resources in parallel

Manila Tempest scenario tests create all resources one by one and they
are very slow because of it.
Therefore, make all resource 'waiters' run after all resource creation
requests are sent.

Change-Id: I435a5d04bce340b0a2c0a2d30fa5a99e50b311e1
Closes-Bug: #1493405
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/65/326365/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import configfrom tempest import test def boot_instance(self, wait_until="ACTIVE"): 'wait_until': wait_until, instance = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILDING") waiters.wait_for_server_status( self.manager.servers_client, instance["id"], "ACTIVE") # Boot two VMs and create share instance1 = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILDING") instance2 = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILDING") self.create_share() for instance in (instance1, instance2): waiters.wait_for_server_status( self.manager.servers_client, instance["id"], "ACTIVE") # Write data to first VM # Read from second VM instance = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILDING") waiters.wait_for_server_status( self.manager.servers_client, instance["id"], "ACTIVE") self.allow_access_ip(self.share['id'], instance=instance, ssh_client = self.init_ssh(instance)
deleted_lines: from tempest import config # noqafrom tempest import test # noqa def boot_instance(self): 'wait_until': 'ACTIVE', instance = self.boot_instance() self.create_share() # boot first VM and write data instance1 = self.boot_instance() # boot second VM and read instance2 = self.boot_instance() instance1 = self.boot_instance() self.allow_access_ip(self.share['id'], instance=instance1, ssh_client = self.init_ssh(instance1)

commit_message:
Fix test deprecation warnings.

Address various DeprecationWarnings by getting constants
from neutron_lib where previously missed.

Add stub gate_hook.sh for non-voting dsvm-functional test.

Change-Id: I64bfb169d4a99bcaead125ba6d45bff03cd2958a
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Invalid volume state when manage operation fails

If an exception is thrown during the manage operation the Cinder volume
that is created is left in "creating" state. Previously the volume state
was set to "error".

Closes-Bug: #1603549
Change-Id: I04f522f2bf6eecb51daece53657533672d5fec2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/49/343049/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: model_update = self.driver.manage_existing(volume_ref, manage_existing_ref) except Exception: msg = "Failed to manage existing volume." LOG.exception(_LE(msg)) flow_common.error_out_volume(context, self.db, volume_ref.id, reason=_(msg)) raise

subject: Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-29 23:09:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/1aaafd5c665e4a100eae5418028bc076c206152d', 'message': "Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing

The current identity role list command (both v2 and v3) is
overloaded with just listing roles as well as assignments (if
you provide user, group, project or domain options). This is
in addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious.

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignmnets list
- Deprecates the use of role list to list assignments

One limitation with the assignment list is that it does not support
taking the user or project from the authentication scope, since it
isn't obvious whether that is the intention of the called.

Change-Id: I65bafdef4f8c89e863dab101369d0d629fa818b8
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-29 23:13:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/e4f8463dbcd467882d02039ee8e8d5a18561eb08', 'message': "Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing

The current identity role list command (both v2 and v3) is
overloaded with listing roles as well as assignments (if you
provide user, group, project or domain options). This is in
addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious (this is in a follow on patch).

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignmnets list
- Deprecates the use of role list and user role list to list
assignments

One limitation with the assignment list is that it does not support
taking the user or project from the authentication scope, since it
isn't obvious whether that is the intention of the called.

addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious (this is in a follow on patch).

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignments list, with support for pulling the
user and project from the auth credentials
- For comapability, adds the same auth support to the
existing v3 assignments list
- Deprecates the use of role list and user role list to list
assignments

Change-Id: I65bafdef4f8c89e863dab101369d0d629fa818b8

commit_message:
Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing

The current identity role list command (both v2 and v3) is
overloaded with listing roles as well as assignments (if you
provide user, group, project or domain options). This is in
addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious (this is in a follow on patch).

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignments list, with support for pulling the
user and project from the auth credentials
- For comapability, adds the same auth support to the
existing v3 assignments list
- Deprecates the use of role list and user role list to list
assignments

Change-Id: I65bafdef4f8c89e863dab101369d0d629fa818b8
Partial-Bug: 1605774

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # import copy from openstackclient.common import exceptions from openstackclient.identity.v2_0 import role_assignment from openstackclient.tests import fakes from openstackclient.tests.identity.v2_0 import fakes as identity_fakes class TestRoleAssignment(identity_fakes.TestIdentityv2): def setUp(self): super(TestRoleAssignment, self).setUp() class TestRoleAssignmentList(TestRoleAssignment): columns = ( 'Role', 'User', 'Project', ) def setUp(self): super(TestRoleAssignment, self).setUp() # Get a shortcut to the UserManager Mock self.users_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.users self.users_mock.reset_mock() # Get a shortcut to the ProjectManager Mock self.projects_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.projects self.projects_mock.reset_mock() # Get a shortcut to the RoleManager Mock self.roles_mock = self.app.client_manager.identity.roles self.roles_mock.reset_mock() self.projects_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.PROJECT), loaded=True, ) self.users_mock.get.return_value = fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.USER), loaded=True, ) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.return_value = [ fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy(identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ), ] # Get the command object to test self.cmd = role_assignment.ListRoleAssignment(self.app, None) def test_role_assignment_list_no_filters(self): arglist = [] verifylist = [] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # This argument combination should raise a CommandError self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandError, self.cmd.take_action, parsed_args, ) def test_role_assignment_list_only_project_filter(self): arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.project_name, ] verifylist = [ ('project', identity_fakes.project_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # This argument combination should raise a CommandError self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandError, self.cmd.take_action, parsed_args, ) def test_role_assignment_list_only_user_filter(self): arglist = [ '--user', identity_fakes.user_name, ] verifylist = [ ('user', identity_fakes.user_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # This argument combination should raise a CommandError self.assertRaises( exceptions.CommandError, self.cmd.take_action, parsed_args, ) def test_role_assignment_list_project_and_user(self): self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.return_value = [ fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy( identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ), fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy( identity_fakes.ROLE_2), loaded=True, ), ] arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.project_name, '--user', identity_fakes.user_name, ] verifylist = [ ('user', identity_fakes.user_name), ('project', identity_fakes.project_name), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # In base command class Lister in cliff, abstract method take_action() # returns a tuple containing the column names and an iterable # containing the data to be listed. columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) datalist = (( identity_fakes.role_id, identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ), (identity_fakes.ROLE_2['id'], identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ),) self.assertEqual(datalist, tuple(data)) def test_role_assignment_list_by_name_project_and_user(self): self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.return_value = [ fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy( identity_fakes.ROLE), loaded=True, ), fakes.FakeResource( None, copy.deepcopy( identity_fakes.ROLE_2), loaded=True, ), ] arglist = [ '--project', identity_fakes.project_name, '--user', identity_fakes.user_name, '--names' ] verifylist = [ ('user', identity_fakes.user_name), ('project', identity_fakes.project_name), ('names', True), ] parsed_args = self.check_parser(self.cmd, arglist, verifylist) # In base command class Lister in cliff, abstract method take_action() # returns a tuple containing the column names and an iterable # containing the data to be listed. columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.roles_mock.roles_for_user.assert_called_with( identity_fakes.user_id, identity_fakes.project_id, ) self.assertEqual(self.columns, columns) datalist = (( identity_fakes.role_name, identity_fakes.user_name, identity_fakes.project_name, ), (identity_fakes.ROLE_2['name'], identity_fakes.user_name, identity_fakes.project_name, ),) self.assertEqual(datalist, tuple(data))

This patch implements PCI-DSS password strength requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.3: Passwords/phrases must meet the following: 1) Require a
minimum length of at least seven characters. 2) Contain both numeric and
alphabetic characters. Alternatively, the passwords/phrases must have
complexity and strength at least equivalent to the parameters specified
above.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

This patch implements PCI-DSS password strength requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.3: Passwords/phrases must meet the following: 1) Require a
minimum length of at least seven characters. 2) Contain both numeric and
alphabetic characters. Alternatively, the passwords/phrases must have
complexity and strength at least equivalent to the parameters specified
above.

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Password strength requirements

This patch implements PCI-DSS password strength requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.3: Passwords/phrases must meet the following: 1) Require a
minimum length of at least seven characters. 2) Contain both numeric and
alphabetic characters. Alternatively, the passwords/phrases must have
complexity and strength at least equivalent to the parameters specified
above.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: I32ef8deb0a7c48511229f95f7cc973ab0d183372

commit_message:
Don't kill zuul-console service

This is no longer needed, as zuul-console now uses port 19885.

Change-Id: I40ba1fe731bd413780a4968409677bd96869dcae
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/28/346228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if [ -n "$STABLE_RELEASE" ]; then # Kill the zuul console stream, its tcp port clashes with the port we're using to serve out /httpboot # This is not needed on master since we're able to configure a different # port for httpd ipxe using hieradata_override sudo netstat -lpn | grep tcp | grep :8088 | awk '{print $7}' | cut -d / -f 1 | head -n 1 | sudo xargs -r -t kill fi

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the neutron database are
being renamed to ``project_id``.

This neutron-dynamic-routing change accompanies the neutron change:
I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

Change-Id: If6a4db955a2e00635a37605dc165cf9f2f0fac31
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Huawei Technologies India Pvt Limited. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """rename tenant to project Revision ID: 4cf8bc3edb66 Revises: 61cc795e43e8 Create Date: 2016-07-14 17:32:00.852342 """ from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy.engine import reflection # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '4cf8bc3edb66' down_revision = '61cc795e43e8' _INSPECTOR = None def get_inspector(): """Reuse inspector""" global _INSPECTOR if _INSPECTOR: return _INSPECTOR else: bind = op.get_bind() _INSPECTOR = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(bind) return _INSPECTOR def get_tables(): """ Returns hardcoded list of tables which have ``tenant_id`` column. The list is hardcoded to match the state of the schema when this upgrade script is run. """ tables = [ 'bgp_peers', 'bgp_speakers', ] return tables def get_columns(table): """Returns list of columns for given table.""" inspector = get_inspector() return inspector.get_columns(table) def get_data(): """Returns combined list of tuples: [(table, column)]. The list is built from tables with a tenant_id column. """ output = [] tables = get_tables() for table in tables: columns = get_columns(table) for column in columns: if column['name'] == 'tenant_id': output.append((table, column)) return output def alter_column(table, column): old_name = 'tenant_id' new_name = 'project_id' op.alter_column( table_name=table, column_name=old_name, new_column_name=new_name, existing_type=column['type'], existing_nullable=column['nullable'] ) def recreate_index(index, table_name): old_name = index['name'] new_name = old_name.replace('tenant', 'project') op.drop_index(op.f(old_name), table_name) op.create_index(new_name, table_name, ['project_id']) def upgrade(): """Code reused from Change-Id: I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc """ inspector = get_inspector() data = get_data() for table, column in data: alter_column(table, column) indexes = inspector.get_indexes(table) for index in indexes: if 'tenant_id' in index['name']: recreate_index(index, table) def contract_creation_exceptions(): """Special migration for the blueprint to support Keystone V3. We drop all tenant_id columns and create project_id columns instead. """ return { sa.Column: ['.'.join([table, 'project_id']) for table in get_tables()], sa.Index: get_tables() }

commit_message:
Make environment-action-call command accept JSON arguments

Actions can accept different data types as arguments (strings,
numbers, dicts, lists). Previously only strings could be passed
to action through command line. Now CLI accepts arguments in
JSON format additionally to the simple old format.

Change-Id: Ic71d825fca4d9791055b4f82c6574d385e23f8ff
Closes-bug: #1604852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/81/344881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.shell("""environment-action-call 12345 --action-id 54321 --arguments foo=bar dictArg={"key1":"value1","key2":"value2"} listArg=["item1","item2","item3"] nullArg=null stringArg="null" intArg=5 compoundArg=["foo",14,{"key1":null,"key2":8}]""") '12345', '54321', arguments={ 'foo': 'bar', 'dictArg': {u'key1': u'value1', u'key2': u'value2'}, 'listArg': [u'item1', u'item2', u'item3'], 'nullArg': None, 'stringArg': u'null', 'intArg': 5, 'compoundArg': [u'foo', 14, {u'key1': None, u'key2': 8}] })

commit_message:
Remove the mask password logic in vim list and vim show

In vim list and vim show command,
since hashed password masking on server-side,
the "mask_dict_password" modules are removed on client-side.

Change-Id: I463cb04696dc09157fbbc4b0bd64e66850feac84
Depends-On: Ice5c51b6a66cd27f21c144d3a672cf790e4cec41
Closes-bug: #1594495

subject: Disbale DNS update for port o-hm0 in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 09:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['etc/dhcp/dhclient.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a4f3931ca29073e8a5a943504b7c4404fdbb9f3a', 'message': 'Disbale DNS update for port o-hm0 in devstack

Disable the DNS update for port o-hm0 during the installation of
devstack to aviod accidentally DNS change.

Note: NetworkManager will attempt to write DNS information from
DHCP into /etc/resolv.conf, overwriting the existing contents.
So, if you have NetworkManager enabled, the once for all solution
should be set the immutable bit on the file:
    chattr +i /etc/resolv.conf

Change-Id: Icbc23feb8cb3c9967aa66a3c6c2f61da61397d11
'}]
commit_message:
Disbale DNS update for port o-hm0 in devstack

Disable the DNS update for port o-hm0 during the installation of
devstack to aviod accidentally DNS change.

Note: NetworkManager will attempt to write DNS information from
DHCP into /etc/resolv.conf, overwriting the existing contents.
So, if you have NetworkManager enabled, the once for all solution
should be set the immutable bit on the file:
    chattr +i /etc/resolv.conf

Change-Id: Icbc23feb8cb3c9967aa66a3c6c2f61da61397d11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/41/343541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Dell SC: Add secondary DSM support

Adds support for a secondary DSM in case the primary becomes
unavailable.

Added thin_provisioning_support = True to the volume stats since
the Dell driver only supports thin provisioning.

Change-Id: I1b2875aa275a72b4f434d8c3d20c82b176ec4dc0

commit_message:
Provide default for rabbitmq telemetry password

In order to maintain current behavior when deploying ceilometer using
the integrated release, default 'cinder_rabbitmq_telemetry_password'
to 'cinder_rabbitmq_password'. 'cinder_rabbitmq_telemetry_*' vars
may be provided by the user as overrides if a separate rabbitmq cluster
is being used for telemetry.

Also update the configured transport_urls to only include a comma
between urls and re-add rabbit configuration information to the
oslo_messaging_rabbit block.

Change-Id: Ie08ee95eb16120c8747f32cd8d27325fe8bef0d5

commit_message:
Cleanup the toastService in *.spec.js files

We should not use toastService to test if an API call
went through successfully. This is extraneous.

This patch was motivated by the fact that we want to
remove conf.js, so we are moving the toast config
options to toast.service.js.

Change-Id: I966fb0d492ae8e9ae70af2882655cd36b4214a4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/76/345676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: var novaAPI, ctrl, toastService, $q, $rootScope; toastService = $injector.get('horizon.framework.widgets.toast.service'); spyOn(toastService, 'add').and.callThrough(); expect(toastService.add).toHaveBeenCalledWith( 'success', 'Successfully imported key pair newKeypair.');

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Adds password_expires_at to API docs

This patch adds a new user response attribute, password_expires_at,
to the Identity API v3 documentation.

Passord expires validation implementation:
https://review.openstack.org/333360

Depends-On: I07c10de627898d6ac79578dc24292ded4a2190f1
Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss
Change-Id: I37136f79488d7469f0b8b24e3f5628899e40cac0

commit_message:
Allow auto-addressed ips deletion on port update

By default ips for auto-addressed subnets can not be removed from port
using port_update workflow. But during subnet_delete it has to be done
via update_port to make sure that ipam drivers received appropriate call
to deallocate ip addresses prior to subnet deletion.

'fixed_ips' property is tweeked to allow deletion ips from
auto-addressed subnet. 'delete_subnet' boolean is added to mark subnet
that is going to be deleted. This flag is analysed in
_get_changed_ips_for_port to skip re-adding slaac subnets for the port.

Closes-Bug: #1564335
Change-Id: Iec171efe8b64f8a6dc6cb003b97c11667c5e0048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/45/323345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # were correctly deleted during the previous pass. fixed_ips = [{'subnet_id': ip.subnet_id, 'ip_address': ip.ip_address} for ip in a.port.fixed_ips if ip.subnet_id != id] # By default auto-addressed ips are not removed from port # on port update, so mark subnet with 'delete_subnet' flag # to force ip deallocation on port update. if is_auto_addr_subnet: fixed_ips.append({'subnet_id': id, 'delete_subnet': True}) data = {attributes.PORT: {'fixed_ips': fixed_ips}}
deleted_lines: # SLAAC allocations are currently can not be removed using # update_port workflow, and will persist in 'allocated'. # So for now just make sure update_port is called once for # them so MechanismDrivers is aware of the change. # This way SLAAC allocation is deleted by FK on subnet deletion # TODO(pbondar): rework update_port workflow to allow deletion # of SLAAC allocation via update_port. # (except SLAAC allocations) were correctly deleted during # the previous pass. data = {attributes.PORT: {'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': ip.subnet_id, 'ip_address': ip.ip_address} for ip in a.port.fixed_ips if ip.subnet_id != id]}}

commit_message:
Provide default for rabbitmq telemetry password

In order to maintain current behavior when deploying ceilometer using
the integrated release, default 'glance_rabbitmq_telemetry_password'
to 'glance_rabbitmq_password'. 'glance_rabbitmq_telemetry_*' vars
may be provided by the user as overrides if a separate rabbitmq cluster
is being used for telemetry.

Also update the configured transport_urls to only include a comma
between urls and re-add rabbit configuration information to the
oslo_messaging_rabbit block.

Change-Id: I74fcd572acd029ae991fea8d00f8bb4e0251ccc8

commit_message:
Revisit (add|remove)_subports request body

The neutronclient [1] expects to serialize a dictionary any
time there is a body in the request. The (add|remove)_subports
methods were expecting a list of dicts instead.

This patch rectifies the issue by assuming a dict in the
body of the format {'sub_ports': [<my-subports]}. This is
indeed the most conventional way to pass request data to
Neutron server, and it was overlooked during a past review.

This was discovered during development of the client side
patch [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/blob/master/neutronclient/v2_0/client.py#L292
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340624/

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I8d36c61dd877d0ccb73c18702ed64897b71f001b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/345185/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp, body = self.put(uri, jsonutils.dumps({'sub_ports': subports}))

commit_message:
Improve the segmentation ID validation logic

Segmentation ID is meant to be an Integer as per model,
and as such it is best to attempt a conversion in case
it happens to be sent as string as done in [1]. The
failure mode in this case is not immediately obvious
as the ID range check fails and yet the ID is indeed
in range.

This patch also dedups some logic, clean up and add a
test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340624/7/neutronclient/osc/v2/trunk/subport.py@36

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I7ca4c93fdf0ab83088194e9a343448ed511d4cdb

subject: Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-02 15:35:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9b45847936d93b3de4e15b7aeb0daf37f0225da8', 'message': 'Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (TODO: link).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-02 22:23:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e550e77023f4beca95b96b74415d3d52fd758019', 'message': 'Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (TODO: link).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-14 14:46:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9b85dbe4ceebb5c3f126bc87e2d7d3cb576c42fa', 'message': 'Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (specifically, before Mitaka, all networks
were getting MTU = 0 by default, disabling both advertisement and data
path MTU size enforcement).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

DocImpact Now changes to MTU configuration options immediately affect
          existing network MTUs, not just new networks.

UpgradeImpact Existing networks with invalid MTU persisted in database
              may change their MTU values to reflect configuration.

TODO: alembic script to remove mtu attribute
TODO: add unit tests for _get_network_mtu
TODO: add unit test that will validate dynamic nature of MTU field

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182

commit_message:
Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (specifically, before Mitaka, all networks
were getting MTU = 0 by default, disabling both advertisement and data
path MTU size enforcement).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

DocImpact Now changes to MTU configuration options immediately affect
          existing network MTUs, not just new networks.

UpgradeImpact Existing networks with invalid MTU persisted in database
              may change their MTU values to reflect configuration.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182

commit_message:
objects: better apply filters for objects/db/api/get_object query.

Problem found when querying for shared subnet. Current implementation for
filtering is applying the filter_by(id=xxx) to NetworkRBAC id, not the
subnets.id field.

Change-Id: I9343ccbbb9723582db4365d671505d0bb6eba72d
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
objects: Add RBAC to Subnet OVO

Subnet 'shared' attribute is dependent from network 'shared' state.
Added helper methods in rbac_db to calculate the share state based on
rbac_entries.
Refactor existing RbacNeutronDbObjectMixin is_shared_with_tenant method
to be able to use it within already opened session.

Change-Id: I235cf3d37fefa27c005cff992a08fd324e910e75
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:43:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/subnet.py', 'neutron/objects/port/extensions/allowedaddresspairs.py', 'neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'neutron/objects/subnetpool.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/cf9291310525643767c8dcdb5b2bf2d3130fb794', 'message': "objects: Convert filters to string for list values.

When request from API is passed to get_objects, filters are converted
by modify_fields_to_db. API is passing the arguments with format:
filters = {'key': ['val']}
In some classes (like Subnet, Subnetpool, AllowedAddessPairs) value of
filters has to be converted from IPNetwork, IPAddress and MACAddress
to string value format.

Current implementation in modify_fields_to_db did not take under
consideration that value passed in fields dict can be a list of
CIDRs, IPs or MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I70230a40973f5e7c3d0e325de658830eba036813
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
"}]
commit_message:
objects: Convert filters to string for list values.

When request from API is passed to get_objects, filters are converted
by modify_fields_to_db. API is passing the arguments with format:
filters = {'key': ['val']}
In some classes (like Subnet, Subnetpool, AllowedAddessPairs) value of
filters has to be converted from IPNetwork, IPAddress and MACAddress
to string value format.

Current implementation in modify_fields_to_db did not take under
consideration that value passed in fields dict can be a list of
CIDRs, IPs or MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I70230a40973f5e7c3d0e325de658830eba036813
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Add function to return all hosts with mapped segments

In the agentless topology, for example ovn, hosts might be removed from
the topology, during neutron service down. When neutron service up, a
full sync will be performed. But only existing hosts will be synced.
There is no way to know which hosts are removed, and there are stale
SegmentHostMapping left behind.

This patch adds a function to return all hosts with mapped segments, so
that it is possible to compare existing hosts with all hosts in DB. And
delete stale records if there is any. It is applied at [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/337685

Change-Id: I53863c9983e933872fb0adbc964e5a88d0238bf2
Partially-implements: blueprint routed-networks

added_lines: def test_get_all_hosts_mapped_with_segments(self): ctx = context.get_admin_context() hosts = ['host1', 'host2'] with self.network() as network: network = network['network'] segment1 = self._test_create_segment( network_id=network['id'], physical_network='phys_net1', segmentation_id=200, network_type=p_constants.TYPE_VLAN)['segment'] db.update_segment_host_mapping(ctx, hosts[0], {segment1['id']}) segment2 = self._test_create_segment( network_id=network['id'], physical_network='phys_net1', segmentation_id=201, network_type=p_constants.TYPE_VLAN)['segment'] db.update_segment_host_mapping(ctx, hosts[1], {segment2['id']}) # Now they are 2 hosts with segment being mapped. actual_hosts = db.get_hosts_mapped_with_segments(ctx) self.assertEqual(set(hosts), actual_hosts)

commit_message:
Lazy load oauthlib for plugin loading

If oauthlib is not available the oauth plugins should not be marked as
available when iterating plugins.

Change-Id: Idabb7adf61dc5ca36fc1524af47e346f8f296245

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 00:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/loading/opts.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-prompt-to-opt-d083acc357a7f07b.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v2.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v3.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/generic.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/71d2e1ad7782520362919a579ec1b459fe4c5238', 'message': 'Add prompt parameter to Opt

The prompt parameter is supposed to provide both an indication to
loaders that it is ok to prompt the user for input for an option and

It would be up to the loader whether it wanted to use that message or

This will allow os-client-config and openstackclient better control over

Related-Bug: #1519202

commit_message:
Add prompt parameter to Opt

The prompt parameter is supposed to provide both an indication to
loaders that it is ok to prompt the user for input for an option and
also an appropriate message that can be used.

It would be up to the loader whether it wanted to use that message or
something it generated.

This will allow os-client-config and openstackclient better control over
the loading of sensitive authentication options.

Related-Bug: #1519202
Change-Id: I7c39f25b78404950af6f6eaf21739be1c1ef9c6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/14/338614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: loading.Opt('password', secret=True, prompt='Password: ', help="User's password"),

commit_message:
Update Share Metadata modal form refactoring

This patch removes some redundant code from _update_metadata.html
template, fixes cancel button, adds missing unit tests and removes
a couple of duplicated mocks from existing unit tests.

Change-Id: I60b879efda35bbf3dfb6edd9d72f3dd2a3ecfaa1
Partially-Implements: blueprint form-templates

commit_message:
Fix provider network setup

A recent DevStack change [1] broke the networking-ovn gate. The
change is being reverted [2] to unbreak the gate. However, the
change found a weakness in the OVN provider network setup. In
particular when Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC=True, the
networking-ovn DevStack plugin should setup the bridge and
bridge mapping like it does when Q_USE_PROVIDER_NETWORKING=True.

The vagrant deployment broke in a different way because
PHYSICAL_NETWORK was not set (which is used to set the
flat networks supported). To fix this, the vagrant deployment
will now use the networking-ovn DevStack plugin for basic
provider network setup.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/343072/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345820/

Related-Bug: #1605423
Change-Id: I63dd83b2374071703d341ec9e8d4d28c11174683

commit_message:
objects: introduce NetworkPortSecurity object

Since there are two models for binding, and it's easier if they behave
identically from objects POV, renamed port_id field in PortSecurity into
id, and kept the same fields in NetworkPortSecurity.

Switched db code to using those objects. Some refactoring took place to
reduce code duplication.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Ic104f113c4aa3f0c1448f83fe5128feed7b4444b

commit_message:
Fix validate method definitions

A new argument was added to the validate method of the BaseCustomConstraint
class but the corresponding methods of its subclasses were not fixed to reflect
that. This patch amends the subclass methods to add the new argument.

Change-Id: I166463ec0db9fb01a2eaf0337a3307c854dffc51

commit_message:
Contribution doc change for spec-lite

Refer to new spec lite process from Newton onwards.

Change-Id: I51b90548ee420891ddd1e1e53edb72cf8492f21b
Depends-On: I5f552cede83e6a204c3e469a08b685f1070daab9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/17/282517/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Note (Newton onwards): ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Glance will move away from tracking lite specs as WISHLIST bugs. Instead Newton onwards lite specs may be filled in glance-specs repo. Dedicated lite-specs.rst is provided for each deliverable under the release. Existing WISHLIST 'spec-lite' tagged bug will be honored as lite spec, new ones will not be considered unless filed in glance-spec repo. https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+filebug (For Mitaka only), there are two fields that must be filled: 'summary' and 'further information'. The 'summary' must be brief enough to fit in one line: if you can't describe it in a few words it may mean that you are either trying to capture more than one lite spec at once, or that you are having a hard time defining what you are trying to solve at all.
deleted_lines: https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+filebug, there are two fields that must be filled: 'summary' and 'further information'. The 'summary' must be brief enough to fit in one line: if you can't describe it in a few words it may mean that you are either trying to capture more than one lite spec at once, or that you are having a hard time defining what you are trying to solve at all.

commit_message:
Add missing db sync includes

When you re-run openstack undercloud install and it pulls in some new
version of a service, the DB sync has to be done manually or the
services are broken.  This aims to fix that by explicitly including
the various db::sync manifests.  I'm not quite sure why these aren't
needed for initial deployment atm.

Change-Id: I773975669abe23f5b78b9ccbb70678cc577968a8
Closes-Bug: #1604345
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/04/345604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Change-Id: I2593239e98aa3ebd578d030206299d4868d036ca
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 08:40:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/f3771c4caa131f0f565a08bb66dd64f15771b644', 'message': "Standardise tempest role

All of our roles have a standard pattern for installing services,
however tempest does things slightly differently.  I think most of this
is legacy and this commit brings tempest in line (for the most part)
with how other roles are written.

Note that tempest now has a ``tempest`` cli, and in a future commit we
will update this role to use that instead.  This will allow us to skip
the additional step of cloning the tempest git repo to act as a working
directory when running tests.

For some background as to why this work is being done, newer versions
of tempest are failing when run in an IRR because we are not installing
urllib3 into tempest's venv.  This is not an issue when we do an
integrated build because the repo server actually installs tempest into
the tempest venv, and all requirements get satisfied.  However, when we
install tempest without a repo server we simply install
tempest_pip_packages (which previously did not include tempest itself)
into the tempest venv.  We could update update tempest_pip_packages to
include urllib3, but doing so creates duplicate work as this
requirement is already captured in tempest's requirements.txt.

Conflicts:
	defaults/main.yml
	tasks/tempest_install.yml
	tests/test-vars.yml

commit_message:
Standardise tempest role

All of our roles have a standard pattern for installing services,
however tempest does things slightly differently.  I think most of this
is legacy and this commit brings tempest in line (for the most part)
with how other roles are written.

Note that tempest now has a ``tempest`` cli, and in a future commit we
will update this role to use that instead.  This will allow us to skip
the additional step of cloning the tempest git repo to act as a working
directory when running tests.

For some background as to why this work is being done, newer versions
of tempest are failing when run in an IRR because we are not installing
urllib3 into tempest's venv.  This is not an issue when we do an
integrated build because the repo server actually installs tempest into
the tempest venv, and all requirements get satisfied.  However, when we
install tempest without a repo server we simply install
tempest_pip_packages (which previously did not include tempest itself)
into the tempest venv.  We could update update tempest_pip_packages to
include urllib3, but doing so creates duplicate work as this
requirement is already captured in tempest's requirements.txt.

Conflicts:
	defaults/main.yml
	tasks/tempest_install.yml
	tests/test-vars.yml

Change-Id: I6f3c36a8150b83afabae8d397d5fc7340dbc93fd
(cherry picked from commit 75bd092b9e66e4ef79bfc4449ec60901496128d4)

commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

The ceilometer role is now significantly more configurable
with respect to RabbitMQ cluster configuration. The following
changes have been made:

 * Host group for the ceilometer RabbitMQ cluster is now configurable
   via ceilometer_rabbitmq_host_group. This breaks the strict dependency
   on the rabbitmq_all inventory group

 * All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
   was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

 * Notification agent rabbitmq config now supports service-specific
   clusters for services: glance, nova, neutron, cinder, keystone and heat

Change-Id: I38bfba8d134e152f33df187851d6dd6c250cdd60
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Implement gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-nv

Create single node job to deploy and test a TripleO undercloud only.
The job will be experimental for now.

Change-Id: Ifaa298c95af837dc5da1f69e9be018d6deaefabc

commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Change-Id: Ifa6bc7a68a02b48c6a364266c542702b5c043bb0
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Add missing py34 support for urllib

The changeset to port url methods to py34 (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274425 ) merged before the
one to fix the PXC secure routine, so the newly added
urllib.quote code was missed.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320697

This change bring the url quoting in mysql_common/service.py up to
py34 standards.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: I01f087e945035718e1599f121e1a0e29172557e7

commit_message:
OSprofiler initialization method

Added init_from_conf method, that takes service configuration
and initializes notifier. This allows initialization to be
handled in osprofiler instead of projects/services. Added
oslo.messaging dependency.

Change-Id: I77d0d3b5e9e725507916724dcd28d5fbc6f7f5c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/79/342479/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_messagingfrom osprofiler import web def init_from_conf(conf, context, project, service, host): """Initialize notifier from service configuration :param conf: service configuration :param context: request context :param project: project name (keystone, cinder etc.) :param service: service name that will be profiled :param host: hostname or host IP address that the service will be running on. """ connection_str = conf.profiler.connection_string _notifier = create( connection_str, messaging=oslo_messaging, context=context, transport=oslo_messaging.get_transport(conf), project=project, service=service, host=host) set(_notifier) web.enable(conf.profiler.hmac_keys)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 20:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-base.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/8e28ae1ecdd47e940ca328bb07659f751a9cc998', 'message': "Vagrant: Don't duplicate networking-ovn directory

Vagrantfile will create a sync folder at /home/vagrant/networking-ovn

commit_message:
Vagrant: Don't duplicate networking-ovn directory

Vagrantfile will create a sync folder at /home/vagrant/networking-ovn
to facilitate testing networking-ovn changes stored on the host.
However, DevStack will generate its own clone of networking-ovn under
/opt/stack. As a result, only vagrant networking-ovn changes stored
on the host will be tested.

This patch set fixes the problem by creating a symbolic link from
/opt/stack/networking-ovn to /home/vagrant/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I7f7c73bdaf9b0147af0638b055762dc9f965dba3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/24/346224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Use networking-ovn in vagrant home directory when stacking. sudo mkdir /opt/stack sudo chown vagrant:vagrant /opt/stack ln -s ~/networking-ovn /opt/stack/networking-ovn

commit_message:
Huawei: Check when attach hypermetro volume

Currently when we attach a hypermetro volume,
if the map info is none there is not logged
that is due to the array version does not
support hypermetro.

Change-Id: I51dc3e5b21fb0d44b00e498c4b2144e57b07e73c
Closes-Bug: #1549130

commit_message:
Ensure apt-transport-https is available.

apt-transport-https needs to be installed in the base
container BEFORE we add the new sources.list

commit_message:
Flush puppet output piped to awk

Calling fflush() in the awk command to add timestamps to the puppet
output makes the output appear more quickly when watching the undercloud
install.  Otherwise, the output is being buffered by awk, and is only
updated every so often.

Change-Id: I3d4bf48812f28a2da75d7ad979f49c8e76a76ea7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/21/346021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $@ 2>&1 | awk '{print strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S") " - "$0; fflush()}'

commit_message:
Display ES indices

To allow admins to better control their
Elasticsearch usage, we want to display all
aliases that are currently being used by
Searchlight. This will allow the observant admin
to detect any orphaned indices within
Elasticsearch and deal with them appropriately.

Change-Id: I990f442ea079985615306917bc8a1d59900bbd20
Implements: blueprint Orphaned ES Aliases
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/30/339130/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class AliasCommands(object): def __init__(self): utils.register_plugin_opts() def alias(self, group=None, _type=None, force=False): # Grab a list of aliases used by Searchlight. aliases = [] for res_type, ext in six.iteritems(utils.get_search_plugins()): aliases.append(ext.obj.alias_name_listener) aliases.append(ext.obj.alias_name_search) # Grab the indices associated with the aliases. indices = [] for alias in set(aliases): try: response = es_utils.get_indices(alias) except Exception: # Ignore and continue. pass for index in response.keys(): indices.append(index) print("\nList of Elasticsearch indices used by Searchlight:") for index in set(indices): print(" " + index) print("\n") 'index': IndexCommands, 'alias': AliasCommands

commit_message:
Add ScaleIO image backend

This spec proposes a solution to add support for ScaleIO as image
backend.

Blueprint: scaleio-storage-backend
Change-Id: I478508139de194450dd365ce578787a7aeb1b330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/19/309119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================== ScaleIO as storage backend ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/scaleio-storage-backend Support EMC ScaleIO as a storage backend. Problem description =================== Glance should be able to use EMC ScaleIO - another one software-defined storage \- as an image storage backend. ScaleIO is already supported by Cinder (and os-brick) for volume hosting. It is going to be supported by Nova as an ephemeral storage backend [1]. With Glance supporting ScaleIO Nova and Cinder might improve their performance accessing images directly. There is no special use case for ScaleIO driver in addition to existing ones for a regular storage backend driver. Proposed change =============== Add *sio* module into *glance_store._drivers* package. The module will implement *location.StorageLocation* and *driver.Store* abstract classes. The format of URL to be used with ScaleIO images will be ``sio://cluster_id/volume_id``. Where both identifiers are unique and generated by ScaleIO. E.g. ``sio://101884a5027f35c3/bf7362c700000001``. Alternatives ------------ Using protection domain and storage pool names in image URL: ``sio://cluster_id/protection_domain_name/storage_pool_name/volume_id``. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- ScaleIO cluster must be installed and configured. A protection domain and a storage pool to store images must be created in the cluster. ScaleIO SDC component must be installed on affected Glance nodes. These SDCs must be registered with the cluster. Glance config file must contain these options to let ScaleIO image backend work:: [glance_store] stores += sio [scaleio] rest_server_ip = <ScaleIO Gateway IP> rest_server_username = <ScaleIO Gateway user> rest_server_password = <ScaleIO Gateway user password> protection_domain_name = <ScaleIO protection domain> storage_pool_name = <ScaleIO pool name> default_sdcguid = <ScaleIO SDC guid of compute host> Optional parameters:: [scaleio] provisioning_type = <thick (default) or thin> verify_server_certificate = <True or False (default)> server_certificate_path = <Path to the certificate> rest_server_port = <ScaleIO Gateway port, 443 by default> Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com> Reviewers --------- None. Work Items ---------- * Implement all proposed changes at once. Dependencies ============ A new library *siolib* is used to communicate with ScaleIO via REST API. This library is being developed at the moment and will be available on PyPI in the closest future. Testing ======= * Unit tests. * Will be tested with a new thirdparty ScaleIO CI, using the same or similar infrastructure as ScaleIO Cinder CI does. No new Tempest test will be introduced. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation about usage of ScaleIO for image storage backend will be added. References ========== [1] EMC ScaleIO as ephemeral storage backend: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/scaleio-ephemeral-storage-backend [2] EMC ScaleIO portal: http://www.emc.com/storage/scaleio/index.htm [3] ScaleIO vs Ceph comparison: http://cloudscaling.com/blog/cloud-computing/killing-the-storage-unicorn-purpose-built-scaleio-spanks-multi-purpose-ceph-on-performance/

commit_message:
Spec for improve image quota

Change-Id: I1a51e71d5fee5804527bf9511406ff0f918ccc90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/67/266667/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Image Quota Improvement ======================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/improve-image-quota Now Glance is still using configuration file to set/store the quota, that means the quota is shared by all the tenants. Obviously, it's not reasonable. Problem description =================== Proposed change =============== Alternatives ------------ The other way for quota is just keep what we're using, using the configuration file to store the quota and calculating the usage each time. Data model impact ----------------- Table 'quotas': +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | id | int(11) | NO | PRI | NULL | auto_increment | | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | project_id | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | resource | varchar(255) | NO | | NULL | | | hard_limit | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | | allocated | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ NOTE: 'allocated' is added for the hierarchical-multitenancy and nested quota in the future based on the changed has done in Cinder, see [1] Table 'quota_usage': +---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | id | int(11) | NO | PRI | NULL | auto_increment | | project_id | varchar(255) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | resource | varchar(255) | NO | | NULL | | | in_use | int(11) | NO | | NULL | | | reserved | int(11) | NO | | NULL | | | until_refresh | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | | user_id | varchar(255) | YES | MUL | NULL | | +---------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ Table 'quota_classes': +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | id | int(11) | NO | PRI | NULL | auto_increment | | class_name | varchar(255) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | resource | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | hard_limit | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | +------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+ REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- N/A Notifications impact -------------------- New notifications will be created when create and update the quota for a specific tenant. Other end user impact --------------------- N/A Performance Impact ------------------ Technically, the change won't introduce any performance impact because even for now, Glance still need to talk with database to get the usage. But because now Glance doesn't have a table to store the usage, so each time Glance have to calculate. However, with this change, an usage table will be added. Which will accelerate that process. Meanwhile, a new usage table means each time when create/delete a new image, Glance needs to maitain the usage status for the tenant, which will consume a bit of time. Other deployer impact --------------------- N/A Developer impact ---------------- N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Feilong Wang(flwang) Other contributors: Xiyuan Wang(wangxiyuan) Reviewers --------- Core reviewer(s): Flavio Percoco (flaper87) Erno Kuvaja (jokke) Work Items ---------- 1. Create new tables for quota 2. Add new API endpoints for quota Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= 1. Basic unit test cases will be added. 2. Functional test will be added. 3. Basic API test will be added into tempest. 4. Scenario test will be added into tempest to verify the usage of quota. Documentation Impact ==================== 1. API reference will be updated to reflect the API change. 2. Migration document to let the cloud admin know how to upgrade References ========== [1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/liberty/ cinder-nested-quota-driver.html

commit_message:
Removed unreachable statement

In line 1250 of models.py, an exception is raised.
Any statement after this line is unnecessary, because they
don't get executed.

Change-Id: I680dc889f1c3484028b3023d559e36432aacb000

commit_message:
Adds support for  notification plugins in monacaapi

This review
  1) Removes the hard coded notification types
  2) Adds a new Rest API to get the notification types

Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin
Change-Id: I322d1277c1859c990e150f22eceff122ffd77cea

added_lines: /* * Copyright 2015 FUJITSU LIMITED * (C) Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except * in compliance with the License. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under * the License. */ package monasca.api.infrastructure.persistence.hibernate; import static org.testng.Assert.assertEquals; import java.util.Arrays; import java.util.List; import org.hibernate.SQLQuery; import org.hibernate.Session; import org.hibernate.SessionFactory; import org.hibernate.Transaction; import org.testng.annotations.AfterMethod; import org.testng.annotations.BeforeMethod; import org.testng.annotations.Test; @Test(groups = "orm") public class NotificationMethodTypesSqlRepositoryImplTest { NotificationMethodTypesSqlRepoImpl repo = null; private SessionFactory sessionFactory; private Transaction tx; private final static List<String> DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_METHODS = Arrays.asList("Email", "PagerDuty", "WebHook"); @BeforeMethod protected void beforeMethod() throws Exception { this.sessionFactory = HibernateUtil.getSessionFactory(); this.repo = new NotificationMethodTypesSqlRepoImpl(sessionFactory); this.prepareData(this.sessionFactory); this.tx = this.sessionFactory.openSession().beginTransaction(); } @AfterMethod protected void afterMethod() throws Exception { this.tx.rollback(); this.sessionFactory.close(); this.sessionFactory = null; } protected void prepareData(final SessionFactory sessionFactory) { Session session = null; try { session = sessionFactory.openSession(); session.beginTransaction(); for (String method: DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_METHODS){ SQLQuery insertQuery = session.createSQLQuery("INSERT INTO NOTIFICATION_METHOD_TYPE (name) VALUES(?)"); insertQuery.setParameter(0, method); insertQuery.executeUpdate(); } session.getTransaction().commit(); } finally { if (session != null) { session.close(); } } } @Test(groups = "orm") public void shouldList() { List<String> result = repo.list_notification_method_types(); assertEquals(DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_METHODS, result); } }

added_lines: Copyright 2010-2015 OpenStack FoundationBoth the ``GET /v1/images``, ``GET /v1/images/detail``, ``GET /v2/images``, ``GET /v2/images/detail`` requests take query* ``created_at=OPERATOR:DATETIME`` (This attribute is v2 API only.) Filters images having a ``created_at`` attribute matching ``OPERATOR`` and ``DATETIME``. ``DATETIME`` value is expressed as an ISO 8601 datetime (like 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z). Available operators are ``gt``, ``gte``, ``lt``, ``lte``, ``neq``, and ``eq``. If ``OPERATOR`` and separator ``:`` are omitted, it works as ``eq``. * ``updated_at=OPERATOR:DATETIME`` (This attribute is v2 API only.) Filters images having a ``created_at`` attribute matching ``OPERATOR`` and ``DATETIME``. ``DATETIME`` value is expressed as an ISO 8601 datetime (like 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z). Available operators are ``gt``, ``gte``, ``lt``, ``lte``, ``neq``, and ``eq``. If ``OPERATOR`` and separator ``:`` are omitted, it works as ``eq``.

commit_message:
Don't deprecate `/file` endpoint

At the summit, we discussed keeping the file endpoint around for
service-to-service communication. This patch reflects that in the
approved spec.

Change-Id: I886f4e02a5a79fcbe6f78976c89fc4afb5c18576
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/47/313947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Make the `/file` endpoint as admin only and recommend it to be used only for service-to-service communication
deleted_lines: * Mark the `/file` endpoint as deprecated for non-admin use

commit_message:
v2: Add headers for image-create

Refactoring the image import requires the image-create method to return more
headers. This patch adds the OpenStack-image-import-methods and
OpenStack-image-glance-direct-url headers.

Change-Id: I310193283a1a5e8206feda6cbf46cf39e49d6260
Partially-blueprint: image-import-refactor
Partial-Bug: #1523941
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/81/269781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import_methods = response.headers.get('OpenStack-image-import-methods') self.assertNotEqual(import_methods, '') self.assertEqual( '/v2/images/%s/stage' % UUID1, response.headers.get('OpenStack-image-glance-direct-url'))

commit_message:
Scubber: if run as non-daemon re-raise exception

If the scrubber runs not in daemon mode exit in error
case and re-raise the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1548289

Change-Id: I8d6c245859c0f764411b2098c87e8121ca9d779f
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
centralize config: move image-cache opts

Move image-cache config options to a central location under
glance/conf/image_cache.py

(For lack of a better way to tag a spec-lite in the commit message,
I'm including the gerrit link of spec-lite here for the time being)
Implements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301332

Change-Id: I735dde011828c4a15f400798641af244356e897b

subject: WIP DHCP agents should not set default route to a subnet on another segment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 22:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8decdb1fc4b776e4120dbe81175f86d510592e75', 'message': 'WIP DHCP agents should not set default route to a subnet on another segment

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment has its
own default gateway.  The DHCP was just setting the default gateway to
whatever the first DHCP enabled subnet with a gateway was.  But, that
one might not be on the right segment.

This is a work-around which just catches the RuntimeError and skips
that subnet.  We should discuss how to do this correctly.

Change-Id: I13d790226d4c640f3e5795fe59c771b4069f6a55
'}]
commit_message:
WIP DHCP agents should not set default route to a subnet on another segment

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment has its
own default gateway.  The DHCP was just setting the default gateway to
whatever the first DHCP enabled subnet with a gateway was.  But, that
one might not be on the right segment.

This is a work-around which just catches the RuntimeError and skips
that subnet.  We should discuss how to do this correctly.

Change-Id: I13d790226d4c640f3e5795fe59c771b4069f6a55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/340592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
'image-show' does not show attributes whose value is 'None'

It will be removed whose value is 'None' in function meta of class
ImageSerializer,user will not know these attributes in this case.
So remove the filter for value with 'None'.

Change-Id: I91e2c8bf8c87c670ebf18eb073160ed7e9b9e8aa
Closes-Bug: #1551225

commit_message:
Add tar as a disk_format to glance

Ironic project is adding support to deploy OS tarballs
using IPA. Adding disk_format tar to glance is the first
step in implementing tar payload support in ironic.

Change-Id: Ic13a29ec6a62179cec8416fa10bd3d6bedb91e1a
Partial-Bug:1535900

commit_message:
raise changed to "save_and_reraise_exception"

excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() should be used instead of
re-raise as in some cases the exception context can be cleared,
resulting in None being attempted to be re-raised after an exception
handler is run (see excutils.save_and_reraise_exception for more).

Closes-Bug:#1281453
Change-Id: I2770ff3acbe8ea8bfa287cd17020040d55c216b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/00/263300/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import excutils with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_LE("Unable to scrub image %(id)s from a location. " "Reason: %(exc)s ") % {'id': image_id, 'exc': encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)})
deleted_lines: LOG.error(_LE("Unable to scrub image %(id)s from a location. " "Reason: %(exc)s ") % {'id': image_id, 'exc': encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)}) raise

commit_message:
Bump the API version to 2.4

The work on the image import process requires the API version to be
bumped to indicate the addition of this new feature and everything
related to it.

This patch kicks of the work related to this spec.

MitakaPriority
Closes-bug: #1523934
Partially-Implements blueprint: image-import-refactor

Change-Id: I5c7f485f97719af876fcc89ac16522d81824efc1

commit_message:
Deprecate config options for image locations

In the current implementation the following options define if
image location should be available in image-show output:
show_multiple_locations and show_image_direct_url.
This functionality is already covered by policy.json
so we don't need to repeat the code and choose only one
approach: use policy.json to manage an access to image locations.

Change-Id: Ic0983baae7f63982aa0f57be561b54a0fc17e442
Closes-Bug: #1535437
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/99/270199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Extend attempting to use a version for keystone if it is not in the
url. Currently it only raises in the case that
exception.AuthorizationFailure is returned. This will also do in in the
case that exception.AuthUrlNotFound is returned, possibly causing a
correct url and going through.

This also adds some logging lines to make it easier to debug in the
future.

Currently the prefetcher only works for public images (images that the

commit_message:
Fix glance-cache-prefetcher

Extend attempting to use a version for keystone if it is not in the
url. Currently it only raises in the case that
exception.AuthorizationFailure is returned. This will also do in in the
case that exception.AuthUrlNotFound is returned, possibly causing a
correct url and going through.

This also adds some logging lines to make it easier to debug in the
future.

Currently the prefetcher only works for public images (images that the
user 'glance' has access to in the registry).

Change-Id: I1ff7175feade22150d33f106c6f6e93fd59fa8e6
Closes-Bug: 1540934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/22/275322/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except (exception.AuthorizationFailure, exception.AuthUrlNotFound): LOG.debug("Auth_url is now: %s" % auth_url)

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-16 21:25:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/ac86e5697bc242c6cdbd1f49b4d766cd1deb2fb6', 'message': "Update all SHAs for 12.1.1

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/liberty.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies.

Change-Id: Ic8a2d8d34418f71d55d3e359599a1b449b70a94f
Depends-On: I5be589bc34ab4f0478c76733ebf380e975071564
Depends-On: I36d2044965c8a0809a417083c3f24c406b5a36c9

setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/liberty.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies.

Change-Id: Ic8a2d8d34418f71d55d3e359599a1b449b70a94f
Depends-On: I5be589bc34ab4f0478c76733ebf380e975071564

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.1.1

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/liberty.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies.

Change-Id: Ic8a2d8d34418f71d55d3e359599a1b449b70a94f
Depends-On: I5be589bc34ab4f0478c76733ebf380e975071564

commit_message:
Hacking: check method argument has mutable objects

Added hacking rule to check if method arguments have
mutable default objects.This hacking prevents method
arguments from passing mutable objects.

Change-Id: Ie46764216ca07aed6630906b33ff3a4b55e8f9b4

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded monasca notification types

This patch enables adding custom notificatin types. Notification
types are moved from ENUM in code to configuration entries. This
enables us to write new notification types without touching the code
in monasca-api

Change-Id: I54302651bd57555a44c8254fe820c0ef64abfa31
Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Run tempest serially

In order to get a better handle on the performance of individual tempest
tests run tempest with a concurrency of 1. This will reduce the amount
of noise tests generate against each other by running at the same time
and give us fairly accurate individual test runtime numbers.

Change-Id: I7958d61d9d3772fb4d083015d8b296bfa9774074
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/87/295487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY=${TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY:-1}

subject: glance-replicator: size: Handle no args better
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 16:54:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/03ce5e004df293fed6571d5bd5aa42a696cb6a85', 'message': "glance-replicator: size: Handle no args better

Check if `args is None` before doing `len(args)` to avoid `object of type
'NoneType` has no len()` error.

Before:

```
$ glance-replicator size
2016-07-04 09:51:19.030 30204 ERROR glance.cmd.replicator [-] replication_size size <server:port>

    Determine the size of a glance instance if dumped to disk.

    server:port: the location of the glance instance.

ERROR: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()
```

After:

```
$ glance-replicator size
2016-07-04 09:52:02.389 30483 ERROR glance.cmd.replicator [-] replication_size size <server:port>

    Determine the size of a glance instance if dumped to disk.

    server:port: the location of the glance instance.

ERROR: Too few arguments.
```

Change-Id: I66b5845cf65b73e701f94b86ba43268342c82e22

commit_message:
glance-replicator: size: Handle no args better

Check if `args is None` before doing `len(args)` to avoid `object of type
'NoneType'` has no len()` error.

Closes-Bug: #1599169

Change-Id: I66b5845cf65b73e701f94b86ba43268342c82e22

commit_message:
DNM - Test removing restricted and multiverse

The restricted and multiverse pockets contain non-free and unsupported
things. A brief scan shows that they don't really contain things we use
- but let's check and see.

Change-Id: I9a6689b0c7828a3227e69c810bb808c752397d17

commit_message:
Do Not Merge Test ansible 2.0 beta

Run devstack gate with ansible 2.0 beta to catch any potential problems
with new ansible early.

Change-Id: I6f82e2d51a9657de164564de14139f83498d09c2

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-04 03:00:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/congress/commit/ad73240386ad8d12b21e01614f36b87d520e712c', 'message': 'Thread-safety analysis

Manually reviewed source code to identify:
- blocking functions [Note(thread-safety): blocking function]
- blocking calls [Note(thread-safety): blocking call]
- potential thread safety issues [FIXME(thread-safety)]

In summary, there are only two main kinds thread safety issues
identified:
1. Every time the API model converts a UUID to a name via the DB,
   but because the call is a blocking call, the executing greenthread
   may yield control. But the time the greenthread resumes, the name
   obtained from the DB may not refer to the item identified by the
   original UUID any more.
   If the original request was done by name (converted to UUID for
   API), then the behavior might be acceptable. If user says
   "delete nova", but by the time the request is processed nove
   refers to something else, tough luck. But the behavior is not
   acceptable, however, if the original user request was by UUID.
2. Similar to the issue of the synchronizer interrupting a,
   datasource creation, there is an analogous issue with
   datasource deletion.

Reviewed files:
- congress/api/*
- congress/dse2/*
- congress/policy_engine/agnostic.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py
- congress/managers/datasource.py
- congress/utils.py

Note: I do not expect this analysis to be complete.

Change-Id: Ic9f85293b91de1734e2682fda755276fe08dc903

commit_message:
Thread-safety review

Manually reviewed source code to identify:
- blocking functions [Note(thread-safety): blocking function]
- blocking calls [Note(thread-safety): blocking call]
- potential thread safety issues [FIXME(thread-safety)]

In summary, there are only two main kinds thread safety issues
identified:
1. Every time the API model converts a UUID to a name via the DB,
   but because the call is a blocking call, the executing greenthread
   may yield control. But the time the greenthread resumes, the name
   obtained from the DB may not refer to the item identified by the
   original UUID any more.
   If the original request was done by name (converted to UUID for
   API), then the behavior might be acceptable. If user says
   "delete nova", but by the time the request is processed nove
   refers to something else, tough luck. But the behavior is not
   acceptable, however, if the original user request was by UUID.
2. Similar to the issue of the synchronizer interrupting a,
   datasource creation, there is an analogous issue with
   datasource deletion.

Reviewed files:
- congress/api/*
- congress/dse2/*
- congress/policy_engine/agnostic.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py
- congress/managers/datasource.py
- congress/utils.py

Note: I do not expect this analysis to be complete.

Change-Id: Ic9f85293b91de1734e2682fda755276fe08dc903
