Change-Id: I6f5eedf7d04cd4486fbc5d3251029f331d12d510
"}]
commit_message:
apt-get needs access to tty so give it access

When we run stack.sh it runs apt-get which hangs on SIGTTIN if we don't
give it access to its TTY. Timeout by default removes access if you
don't pass in the --foreground option which leads to hung devstack runs.

Run timeout with --foreground to avoid this problem. Note that child
processes are not killed when you use the --foreground option with
timeout, but this should be ok as the timeout should cause any jobs to
fail, children processes will get reparented to init and reaped.

Change-Id: I6f5eedf7d04cd4486fbc5d3251029f331d12d510
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/80/160480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timeout --foreground -s 9 ${REMAINING_TIME}m $BASE/new/devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate.sh

commit_message:
Allow GlusterFS backend for cinder

This patch adds the project stackforge/devstack-plugin-glusterfs to
devstack-vm-age-wrap.sh file, which is reqired to enable glusterfs
gate job.

Change-Id: I5d00a5dbc9b60d5eb8e7c0f59c88c550431353be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/08/143308/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_GLUSTERFS" == "1" ]]; then echo "enable_service glusterfs" >>"$localrc_file" echo "CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=glusterfs:glusterfs" >>"$localrc_file" echo "TEMPEST_STORAGE_PROTOCOL=gluster" >>"$localrc_file" echo "GLUSTERFS_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE=8G" >>"$localrc_file" fi

commit_message:
Add DriverFilter and GoodnessWeigher to manila

This patch ports cinder's DriverFilter and GoodnessWeigher to manila.
These can use two new properties provided by backends,
'filter_function' and 'goodness_function', which can be used to filter
and weigh qualified backends, respectively.

Reference for cinder spec: I59b607a88953a346aa35e67e785a0417a7ce8cc9
Reference for cinder commit: I38408ab49b6ed869c1faae746ee64a3bae86be58

DocImpact
Change-Id: I873f4152e16efdeb30ceae26335a7974dc9b4b69
Implements: blueprint driver-filter-goodness-weigher

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_context import context from manila.scheduler.filters import driver from manila import test from manila.tests.scheduler import fakes class HostFiltersTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(HostFiltersTestCase, self).setUp() self.context = context.RequestContext('fake', 'fake') self.filter = driver.DriverFilter() def test_passing_function(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': '1 == 1', } }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_failing_function(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': '1 == 2', } }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertFalse(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_no_filter_function(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': None, } }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_not_implemented(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': {} }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_no_share_extra_specs(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': '1 == 1', } }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_extra_spec_replacement(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': 'extra.var == 1', } }) filter_properties = { 'share_type': { 'extra_specs': { 'var': 1, } } } self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_stats_replacement(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'total_capacity_gb': 100, 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': 'stats.total_capacity_gb < 200', } }) filter_properties = {'share_type': {}} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_share_replacement(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': 'share.size < 5', } }) filter_properties = { 'request_spec': { 'share_properties': { 'size': 1 } } } self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_qos_spec_replacement(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': 'qos.var == 1', } }) filter_properties = { 'qos_specs': { 'var': 1 } } self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_exception_caught(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': '1 / 0 == 0', } }) filter_properties = {} self.assertFalse(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_function_empty_qos(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'filter_function': 'qos.maxiops == 1', } }) filter_properties = { 'qos_specs': None } self.assertFalse(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_capabilities(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'foo': 10, 'filter_function': 'capabilities.foo == 10', }, }) filter_properties = {} self.assertTrue(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties)) def test_wrong_capabilities(self): host1 = fakes.FakeHostState( 'host1', { 'capabilities': { 'bar': 10, 'filter_function': 'capabilities.foo == 10', }, }) filter_properties = {} self.assertFalse(self.filter.host_passes(host1, filter_properties))

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I50234892bd3dadcda533d97c03414067e06ef0f4
Closes-Bug: #1586268
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-congressclient refs/changes/32/337432/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

Remove python-keystoneclient dependency

No need to depend on python-keystoneclient any more.

And also, the example in add_client() is out-of-date.
So remove it.

commit_message:
Added an parameter for neutron::agents::ml2::ovs to enable ovs-dpdk

puppet-vswitch will provide ovs and ovs with dpdk options.
ovs with dpdk has to be enabled only on compute nodes. Added
and option to configure via templates to enable dpdk.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I6cfd13d4979731696b09da52b2618fa33042403d

added_lines: # [*enable_dpdk*] # (optional) Enable or not DPDK with OVS # Defaults to false. # $enable_dpdk = false, if $enable_dpdk { require ::vswitch::dpdk } else { require ::vswitch::ovs }

to README.rst

commit_message:
Correction in PLUMgrid plugin configurations

This patch set corrects some configurations in PLUMgrid neutron plugin to support l2gateway feature.

Doc-ref: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PLUMgrid-Neutron

This change needs to be cherry-picked to stable/liberty and stable/mitaka as well.

Change-Id: I7aba9d59a0422104260f4e1f1d5c20279ae552e2
(cherry picked from commit 154988a20dac3c8d458fc7e9f138fb9a374e4e50)

repo under api-ref/source/v3-ext/ directory.

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Closes-Bug: 1583988
Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
(cherry picked from commit 887f35b0f1fcc2218636564948f36170ed077934)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/35/306335/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hiera('neutron::enable_dhcp_agent',true) and hiera('neutron::enable_l3_agent',true) {

commit_message:
Add note that options should use long format to HIG

This patch ass a note to the HIG that options should use long format
instead of short.

Change-Id: I1513ea732abac1ace03875c651ca2fa87c14b58c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/59/346159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Options names shall begin with two dashes ('--') and use a single dash* Options should use long format (i.e. ``--name`` instead of ``--n``).
deleted_lines: * All long options names shall begin with two dashes ('--') and use a single dash

commit_message:
Update dnspython to 1.14

dnspython 1.14 adds Python 3 support and so can now be used on Python
2 and Python 3. Drop dnspython3 dependency.

Change-Id: I0a860b03800aeeed4375f528e6bf9cca57129db7

commit_message:
Ensure that Apache is installed

In order to use Apache, it must be installed. Somehow this got
missed in https://review.openstack.org/343918 - not sure how
it passed the tests either, but the Aodh role will not install
in the integrated build without this patch.

Change-Id: I197b3c842e1a828fd675bf42cfc14a8640529430
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_aodh refs/changes/71/345971/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add validator to test integers

This is needed to add a validator to weight in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336461/ in order to  close the bug
https://launchpad.net/bugs/1573857.

Change-Id: I63a96f9b8565d5829192055a4d7784845f0c794d
Partial-Bug: 1598879
Partial-Bug: 1603212

added_lines: def test_validate_integer(self): msg = validators.validate_integer(1) self.assertIsNone(msg) msg = validators.validate_integer(0.1) self.assertEqual("'0.1' is not an integer", msg)

Fixing labels for glance's service and pod resources

etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml file.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Change the repos to use upstream default

This changes the default repos scheme to use the upstream
default which is "http" instead of "https". This change is
in support of enabling packages to be cached instead of
proxied which will improve the speed of deployment.

Change-Id: I15111e60cb3e7e57ce4adabf870ff9d8c7d64f29
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/89/346089/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix create container modal style

The input form included "Required" in the field, it isn't needed.
Also the checkbox didn't have the class of themable-checkbox,
this patch add the class suitable for OpenStack style.

Change-Id: I1fdf7bbd5511396f87339f5729104ea9c35dabe2
Closes-Bug: #1590914
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/10/336410/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name="name" type="text" ng-required="true" pattern="[^/]+"> <div class="themable-checkbox"> <input type="checkbox" ng-model="ctrl.model.public" name="public" checked id="id_public">
deleted_lines: name="name" type="text" ng-required="true" pattern="[^/]+" placeholder="{$ 'Required' | translate $}"> <div> <input type="checkbox" ng-model="ctrl.model.public" name="public" checked id="id_public">

subject: Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 18:03:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/2c6eb1939281e7647c8327b833428cb220402c3b', 'message': 'Remove _transpose_component from response path

The _transpose_component needs to be removed from resource2.Resource as
it currently causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

The fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its uses in
the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests were mocking
it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 21:22:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/0da65610b638e9f78cb969fabae9bbf716e78985', 'message': 'Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component

The _transpose_component method needs to be adjusted as it currently
causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

An easy fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its
uses in the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests
were mocking it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

However, as just removing allows extraneous keys into our internal
dictionaries, switching _transpose_component to more of a filter model
is a better solution. This way we only return a dictionary including
keys that we're expecting to actually work with, rather than letting
everything possible in, which a simple removal would do. One example of
a place where this approach to the fix matters is in the Keypair
resource, where we are ignoring the "id" key that is both
inconsistently and also includes inconsistent values. That resource
looks to the "name" key as both the name attribute and an alternate id,
which this change supports properly. Just removing _transpose_component
reintroduces the inconsistent `id` internally, which then makes it
possible to access it via the `id` attribute on Keypair, which breaks
the id/name separation and consistency.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-21 06:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/test_resource2.py', 'openstack/resource2.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/e9fd4ae8796074331f1bdff81983336d5b31533e', 'message': 'Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component

The _transpose_component method needs to be adjusted as it currently
causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

An easy fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its
uses in the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests
were mocking it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

However, as just removing allows extraneous keys into our internal
dictionaries, switching _transpose_component to more of a filter model
is a better solution. This way we only return a dictionary including
keys that we're expecting to actually work with, rather than letting
everything possible in, which a simple removal would do. One example of
a place where this approach to the fix matters is in the Keypair
resource, where we are ignoring the "id" key that is both
inconsistently available and contains inconsistent values. That
resource looks to the "name" key as both the name attribute and an
alternate id, which this change supports properly. Just removing
_transpose_component reintroduces the inconsistent `id` internally,
which then makes it possible to access it via the `id` attribute on
Keypair, which breaks the id/name separation and consistency.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365
'}]
commit_message:
Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component

The _transpose_component method needs to be adjusted as it currently
causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

An easy fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its
uses in the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests
were mocking it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

However, as just removing allows extraneous keys into our internal
dictionaries, switching _transpose_component to more of a filter model
is a better solution. This way we only return a dictionary including
keys that we're expecting to actually work with, rather than letting
everything possible in, which a simple removal would do. One example of
a place where this approach to the fix matters is in the Keypair
resource, where we are ignoring the "id" key that is both
inconsistently available and contains inconsistent values. That
resource looks to the "name" key as both the name attribute and an
alternate id, which this change supports properly. Just removing
_transpose_component reintroduces the inconsistent `id` internally,
which then makes it possible to access it via the `id` attribute on
Keypair, which breaks the id/name separation and consistency.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365

commit_message:
Collate multiple commits to fix the gate

The gate fails because the clients/libraries the code
depends on were upgraded. Fix by merging the following
two commits.

commit 90e55779e9baa1e7cbdc6e0c737f32bb73721524
Author: Oleksii Chuprykov <ochuprykov@mirantis.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 18 15:29:18 2016 +0300

    Add direct_use=False flag to constructor of novaclient

    As we directly use novaclient class with particular version,
    we need to path direct_use=False to avoid fails.

    Change-Id: Ieb3dcd2b48a172a4e7ad55e44dcdf6329c8bcb0c
    Closes-Bug: #1603976

commit 0156e98e66c9a26649897f0e0b7cd0907cbebff5
Author: Dmitriy Uvarenkov <duvarenkov@mirantis.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 15 13:09:15 2016 +0300

    Fix stack deleting problem in magnum stacks

    In magnumclient/exceptions.py exceptions are imported
    from magnumclient.common.apiclient so exception class
    is not the same as expected in heat/engine/clients/os/magnum.py

    Closes-Bug: #1570781
    Change-Id: Ie60a735470b9adc38675b613950e6480e28136ab

Closes-Bug: #1605617
Change-Id: Ie4519584a0be6e399a08ca281e8e0f4049c52720

commit_message:
Make Zuul python 3 job voting

Make the zuul python3 job voting. This depends upon the entire
python 3 chain (including the log size reduction).

Change-Id: I53196f11a312a7b31bb3327444e5704535ddc85e
Depends-On: I893418435c538bfcedb803d12b57832c8111f06f

commit_message:
Remove the sample config from the git tree

The sameple config is no longer maintained in the git repository but
is maintained on the docs.openstack.org site at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/sample_config.html and
can be generated on demand.

Change-Id: Ic90c81b3effc981cadfd6ad40008950db24bc275
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/36/335236/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Small workloads (single process) like devstack can # use the dogpile.cache.memory backend. (string value) #backend = dogpile.cache.null # Arguments supplied to the backend module. Specify this option once per # argument to be passed to the dogpile.cache backend. Example format: # "<argname>:<value>". (multi valued) #backend_argument = # Proxy classes to import that will affect the way the dogpile.cache backend # functions. See the dogpile.cache documentation on changing-backend-behavior. # (list value) #proxies = # Global toggle for caching. subject: Remove update_flavor method from compute
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 12:22:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/aeaae2c6294b4ce444ee9fe8d5668a7995534b63', 'message': 'Remove update_flavor method from compute

update_flavor API is not supported by nova and raises
HttpException: Bad Request if called from openstacksdk,
hence removed this method to cleanup the source code.

Closes-Bug: 1563235
Change-Id: I1c54d0afcd8b49cac9d7342e466e6636b5c599f1

update_flavor API is not supported by nova and raises
HttpException: Bad Request if called from openstacksdk,
hence removed this method to cleanup the source code.

commit_message:
Remove update_flavor method from compute

update_flavor API is not supported by nova and raises
HttpException: Bad Request if called from openstacksdk,
hence removed this method to cleanup the source code.

Closes-Bug: 1563235
Change-Id: I1c54d0afcd8b49cac9d7342e466e6636b5c599f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/40/340340/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def update_flavor(self, flavor, **attrs): """Update a flavor :param flavor: Either the ID of a flavor or a :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.flavor.Flavor` instance. :attrs kwargs: The attributes to update on the flavor represented by ``value``. :returns: The updated flavor :rtype: :class:`~openstack.compute.v2.flavor.Flavor` """ return self._update(_flavor.Flavor, flavor, **attrs)

subject: Spread instances across NUMA nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 20:50:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eb0d6a4ad4ed2ea4af159cfed4a100e644615e23', 'message': 'Spread instances across NUMA nodes

NUMA placement criteria is undefined and produces unexpected behavior.

This patch fixes how instances are placed over NUMA nodes. The current
behavior has undesired effects, as packing all instances to node 0: e.g:
when hw:numa_nodes=1, the result was to pack all instances on node 0,
leaving the other nodes free (unused):
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node0, instance3 --> node0

The new criteria optimizes NUMA usage by spreading instances across all
NUMA nodes, by choosing/favoring the less packed ones:
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node1, instance3 --> node2

Some other possible criteria are: packing or random. A new config setting
in the flavor or image metadata is required to implement those, though.
Also, for packing, there are some (non-trivial) changes required to make
the cell node accountable, by updating host_cell.avail_cpus.

Change-Id: I2bb9887184827340f059b1229ca2df146fe6a7c4
Closes-Bug: #1601994

commit_message:
Spread instances across NUMA nodes

NUMA placement criteria is undefined and produces unexpected behavior.

This patch fixes how instances are placed over NUMA nodes. The current
behavior has undesired effects, as packing all instances to node 0: e.g:
when hw:numa_nodes=1, the result was to pack all instances on node 0,
leaving the other nodes free (unused):
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node0, instance3 --> node0

The new criteria optimizes NUMA usage by spreading instances across all
NUMA nodes, by choosing/favoring the less packed ones:
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node1, instance3 --> node2

Some other possible criteria are: packing or random. A new config setting
in the flavor or image metadata is required to implement those, though.
Also, for packing, there are some (non-trivial) changes required to make
the cell node accountable, by updating host_cell.avail_cpus.

Change-Id: I2bb9887184827340f059b1229ca2df146fe6a7c4
Closes-Bug: #1601994
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/340569/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rfolco): Spread across NUMA nodes, choose less packed node. spread_criteria = lambda x,y: cmp(x.cpu_usage, y.cpu_usage) host_topology.cells = sorted(host_topology.cells, cmp=spread_criteria)

commit_message:
Use Puppet package provider to update OpenStack packages

Instead of using 'yum update' Exec resource to update all packages, use
Puppet package resource collector, so Puppet OpenStack modules will
notify correctly the services that have been updated and db_sync will be
executed.

Change-Id: Ie48bee09897dc6ef9de1888d2bfa32e40b4d7255
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/58/345658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure Puppet will update packages using Package provider # so Puppet OpenStack modules will notify db_sync commands for each service. Package<| tag == 'openstack' |> { ensure => latest } # Then we want to update the rest of packages Package<| tag == 'openstack' |> -> Exec['package-upgrade']

commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9 the
task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Separate the task deploying a user provided ssl cert and key into two
and check them individually for 'rabbitmq_user_ssl_cert' or
'rabbitmq_user_ssl_key' being defined.

Change-Id: I68afa3066ad88ecae95fcb29c78764d02dc38627

commit_message:
Add a router ID retrieval function

This function takes 5 arguments:
- the router name
- the auth url
- the username
- the password
- the tenant name
to pass directly to /usr/bin/openstack router show.  The ID is returned.

Change-Id: Ibd1b71c674e61217484057f55c9d60ec1f4a1995
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/27/345727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright (c) 2016, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:get_router_id, :type => :rvalue) do |args| router_name = args[0] authenv = { :OS_AUTH_URL => args[1], :OS_USERNAME => args[2], :OS_PASSWORD => args[3], :OS_TENANT_NAME => args[4], } saved_env = ENV.to_hash authenv.each do |name, val| ENV[name.to_s] = val end uuid = %x{/usr/bin/openstack router show -f value -c id #{router_name}} uuid.chomp! ENV.clear saved_env.each do |name, val| ENV[name] = val end return uuid end end

commit_message:
Cluster tests get the instance flavor

Cluster tests rely on the instance flavor to be set
already. This works when the single instance tests
run before (they initialize it) but not when
running cluster tests standalone.

Make cluster tests retrieve the flavor themselves.

Change-Id: I8bac99fecc9508bb5452169836e8c28a3e3a92b5

commit_message:
Deploy MySQL using composable role

Using MySQL by using the puppet-tripleo profile, that is already in use
in THT.

It will bring consistency and help to bring undercloud composable later.

Depends-On: I7082f47204fb4e529b164e4c4f1032e7bdd88f02

commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Deprecated configuration using oslo_messaging_rabbit has been replaced
with transport_url based configuration

Change-Id: Ic1eb3bb6346ebdaa0d3bc19a879946c527239dfb
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Add default rules to pick boot disk

Added migration from Fuel 8.0 to 9.0, which adds default rule
to pick bootable disk in volume metadata of release.

(cherry-picked from f1be069f5ee59127dedbed5bb8cc01feed3400f2)

Change-Id: I5d151a29bf52ac3a519049c38b2b671c087f968f
Closes-Bug: #1595209

commit_message:
use parameter to lookup the step instead of hiera again

In some profiles, we were looking up the $step by using Hiera
again, while we already do it in the parameter definition.
When using this class outside THT, it will fail but with this patch, we
could use just set the $step parameter and the rest of the manifest will
work.

Change-Id: I7082f47204fb4e529b164e4c4f1032e7bdd88f02

commit_message:
Increase RabbitMQ maximum file descriptors.

We now allow 65536 open file descriptors to better reflect the
real-world settings of downstream consumers of TripleO.

Closes-Bug: #1600139
Change-Id: Ib04ea6afb2da1a9101839d9d70bc8891d69700ec
(cherry picked from commit 731940616a132d6e83a9c3c341fa9cad8c01d17e)

commit_message:
Adding simple functional testing for the role

Previously only role convergence was tested.

This patch paves the way to have functional testing support
the addition of Xenial support as well as adding more
thorough functional testing using the Tempest plugin
available in the zaqar source.

Change-Id: I593fe5e61df2daca0857548394e04aa2afa35499

commit_message:
Implemented package caching on the repo server

This change implements package caching on the repo server.
To take advantage of this a deploy will need to do nothing more
than setup an apt-proxy configuration file. This will speed up
package delivery while also providing ha capabilities within the
environment.

Change-Id: I78b2fba6a1f294751bd7098513060015cb41300c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Change the repos to use upstream default

This changes the default repos scheme to use the upstream
default which is "http" instead of "https". This change is
in support of enabling packages to be cached instead of
proxied which will improve the speed of deployment.

Change-Id: I67a9fb48ee08866bd59d70730e62b7da28f81125
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add .gitreview and clean up repo

Add src/README.md placeholder to prevent inheritence of the
base layer's readme file in the built charm.

Use the official charms.openstack repo in test-requirements.txt.

Use official designate charm location in the Amulet tests.

Remove upload-and-publish so as not to encourage out-of-band
pushing and publishing.  That is handled by CI.

Remove legacy Makefile.

Rename Amulet test files and drop Icehouse on the Trusty target.

Update tox.ini for Amulet environment variables.

Update metadata.yaml, removing EOL release and adding tags.

Fix apt_pkg mock

Disable py27 unit tests

Change-Id: I5220b73eb41e42cb03e6dac27525140fb21ca449

commit_message:
Fix directory ownership as part of upgrade

This change ensures that when ceph is upgraded from an
older version that uses root to a newer version that
uses ceph as the process owner that all directories
are chowned.

Closes-Bug: 1600338
Change-Id: I162ebdbeee0d7bae4866b6462f98f11e3892b7ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/46/345646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service_stop, service_start, chownr) # Ensure the ownership of Ceph's directories is correct chownr(path=os.path.join(os.sep, "var", "lib", "ceph"), owner=ceph.ceph_user(), group=ceph.ceph_user()) chownr(path=os.path.join(os.sep, "etc", "ceph"), owner=ceph.ceph_user(), group=ceph.ceph_user())

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-13 14:18:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/546d46ad99a0698f02c309a0bbca275cba92dee7', 'message': "libvirt: update guest time after suspend

When an instance is resumed from suspension or a migration, the guest's
clock might get a large delay between the current and the suspension time.
In some cases, NTP might not be able to resynchronize the guest time and
will result in a skewed clock.

In order to address the issue, this patch will try to set the guest time
after it is resumed. This operation will require the guest agent to be
configured and running in order to be able to run. However, this operation

commit_message:
libvirt: update guest time after suspend

When an instance is resumed from suspension or a migration, the guest's
clock might get a large delay between the current and the suspension time.
In some cases, NTP might not be able to resynchronize the guest time and
will result in a skewed clock.

In order to address the issue, this patch will try to set the guest time
after it is resumed. This operation will require the guest agent to be
configured and running in order to be able to run. However, this operation
will not be disruptive.

This code is similar to a change that has been commited to oVirt.
https://gerrit.ovirt.org/#/c/50426

Closes-Bug: #1593745
Change-Id: I2732af50aab238502ccdc067f62290fd962c8c64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/316116/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import timefrom nova.i18n import _LW def _sync_guest_time(self): """ Try to set VM time to the current value. This is typically useful when clock wasn't running on the VM for some time (e.g. during suspension or migration), especially if the time delay exceeds NTP tolerance. It is not guaranteed that the time is actually set (it depends on guest environment, especially QEMU agent presence) or that the set time is very precise (NTP in the guest should take care of it if needed). """ t = time.time() seconds = int(t) nseconds = int((t - seconds) * 10 ** 9) msg = "Failed to set time: %s" try: self._domain.setTime(time={'seconds': seconds, 'nseconds': nseconds}) except libvirt.libvirtError as e: code = e.get_error_code() if code == libvirt.VIR_ERR_AGENT_UNRESPONSIVE: LOG.debug(msg, "QEMU agent unresponsive") elif code == libvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_SUPPORT: LOG.debug(msg, "Not supported") else: LOG.warning(_LW(msg), e) except Exception as ex: # The highest priority is not to let this method crash and thus # disrupt its caller in any way. So we swallow this error here, # to be absolutely safe. LOG.debug(msg, ex) else: LOG.debug('Time updated to: %d.%09d', seconds, nseconds) self._sync_guest_time()

commit_message:
Generate HAProxy certificates in base profile

This gives the option to generate the service certificate(s) that
HAProxy will use. This will be used for both the overcloud and the
undercloud.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I3d0b729d0bad5252c1ae8852109c3a70c0c6ba7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/99/345899/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*generate_service_certificates*] # (Optional) Whether or not certmonger will generate certificates for # HAProxy. This could be as many as specified by the $certificates_specs # variable. # Note that this doesn't configure the certificates in haproxy, it merely # creates the certificates. # Defaults to hiera('generate_service_certificate', false). # # [*certmonger_ca*] # (Optional) The CA that certmonger will use to generate the certificates. # Defaults to hiera('certmonger_ca', 'local'). # # [*certificates_specs*] # (Optional) The specifications to give to certmonger for the certificate(s) # it will create. # Example with hiera: # tripleo::profile::base::haproxy::certificates_specs: # undercloud-haproxy-public-cert: # service_pem: <haproxy ready pem file>, # service_certificate: <service certificate path>, # service_key: <service key path>, # hostname: <undercloud fqdn>, # postsave_cmd: <command to update certificate on resubmit>", # principal: "haproxy/<undercloud_fqdn>" # Defaults to {}. # $enable_load_balancer = hiera('enable_load_balancer', true), $step = hiera('step'), $generate_service_certificates = hiera('generate_service_certificates', false), $certmonger_ca = hiera('certmonger_ca', 'local'), $certificates_specs = {}, if str2bool($generate_service_certificate) { include ::certmonger # This is only needed for certmonger's local CA. For any other CA this # operation (trusting the CA) should be done by the deployer. if $certmonger_ca == 'local' { include ::tripleo::certmonger::ca::local } Certmonger_certificate { ca => $certmonger_ca, ensure => 'present', wait => true, require => Class['::certmonger'], } create_resources('::tripleo::certmonger::haproxy', $certificates_specs) }

commit_message:
Fix directory ownership as part of upgrade

This change ensures that when ceph is upgraded from an
older version that uses root to a newer version that
uses ceph as the process owner that all directories
are chowned.

Closes-Bug: 1600338
Change-Id: Ifac8cde6e6ea6f3a366fb40b9ffd261036720310
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/47/345647/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service_start, chownr) # Ensure the ownership of Ceph's directories is correct chownr(path=os.path.join(os.sep, "var", "lib", "ceph"), owner=ceph.ceph_user(), group=ceph.ceph_user()) chownr(path=os.path.join(os.sep, "etc", "ceph"), owner=ceph.ceph_user(), group=ceph.ceph_user())

commit_message:
Correct the wrong commands

The "openstack quota show" does not support "PROJECT_NAME", there should
use "PROJECT_ID".

Change-Id: I563023618a7047d4065eb3b3d1e177a1a9c35507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/13/346013/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Use :samp:`openstack quota show {PROJECT_ID}` to list all quotas for aUse :samp:`openstack quota set {PROJECT_ID} {--parameters}` to set quota
deleted_lines: Use :samp:`openstack quota show {PROJECT_NAME}` to list all quotas for aUse :samp:`openstack quota set {PROJECT_NAME} {--parameters}` to set quota

commit_message:
Correct Quobyte driver capacity reporting

Current capacity reporting is based on logical values which can
differ significantly from real usage with e.g. sparse files.
This change switches to using physical values and includes free
space correction based on a Quobyte volumes internal replication
factor.
Closes-Bug: #1603434

Change-Id: I74ae2974709a13697412f43a448582be56c21e63
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/54/344154/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: total = float(result['total_physical_capacity']) used = float(result['total_physical_usage']) if free < 0: free = 0 # no space available free_replicated = free / self._get_replication() free = math.floor((free_replicated / units.Gi) * units.G) / units.G def _get_replication(self): result = self.rpc.call('getEffectiveVolumeConfiguration', {'configuration_name': self. configuration.quobyte_volume_configuration}) return int(result['configuration']['volume_metadata_configuration'] ['replication_factor'])
deleted_lines: total = float(result['total_logical_capacity']) used = float(result['total_logical_usage']) free = math.floor((free / units.Gi) * units.G) / units.G

commit_message:
Mask mcollective systemd unit

Mcollective should be disabled in IBP.
This always true for upstart job, but we
missed that for systemd.

Change-Id: I779ecd39c4646f2432c1f43a46971fea8205010f
blueprint: mos-xenial
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/87/335987/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # mask mcollective service os.symlink('/dev/null', os.path.join(chroot, 'etc/systemd/system/mcollective.service'))

/var/log/keystone/keystone-manage.log with incorrect
permissions (it will be owned by root). As a result
db_sync command will fail, because 'keystone' user
is not able to write to this file.

commit_message:
Changes around keystone-manage commands

* perform all keystone-manage commands only as keystone user
* as it possible to override keystone user in init class
  we should also have an ability to override it in db::sync class
* ensure that fernet key directory is created before fernet
  setup command and it's owned by keystone user

Closes-bug: #1604884

Change-Id: Ib90d8e2259b9a650a2edb5f0baf0e68451b9abf6

commit_message:
Xenial support for fuel-bootstrap

Add files required to build Xenial based
bootstrap image. This is for switching to Xenial
in the nearest feature.

blueprint: mos-xenial

Change-Id: I06ee5a036d49c989e977af77dcebd4be01ee7dcd

commit_message:
Move mysql::host param from MysqlInternal to MysqlNoBracketsInternal

The ::host parameter expects IPv6 addresses withouth brackets; this
change aligns the remaining services to use MysqlNoBracketsInternal
as it happens already for the others (eg. Keystone).

Change-Id: Ia72d325447408b1cb5fea836034bbcd75d17ddf1

commit_message:
Add .gitreview and clean up repo

Add src/README.md placeholder to prevent inheritence of the
base layer's readme file in the built charm.

Use the official charms.openstack repo in test-requirements.txt.

Use official designate-bind charm location in the Amulet tests.

Remove upload-and-publish so as not to encourage out-of-band
pushing and publishing.  That is handled by CI.

Fix a test filename typo.

Add tests readme.

Update tox.ini for Amulet environment variables.

Update metadata.yaml, removing EOL release and adding tags.

Fix unit tests

Change-Id: If842a5409c2d284bc118d70d6e8caba7cb6205c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/78/345078/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Overview This directory provides Amulet tests to verify basic deployment functionality from the perspective of this charm, its requirements and its features, as exercised in a subset of the full OpenStack deployment test bundle topology. For full details on functional testing of OpenStack charms please refer to the [functional testing](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/charm-guide/testing.html#functional-testing) section of the OpenStack Charm Guide.

add TestNetworkBasicOps to the tempest skip list

* this test is not running consistently, we are taking it
out until we can ensure it works 99% of the time.

commit_message:
Disable skip_git_sdist flag

This flag prevents other files except python module
to be put in the tarball when running command
python setup.py sdist. However when building rpm/deb packages
we need all files to be in the tarball.

Change-Id: I10ac546f2dbc214743c7bef65cb032b8ccbe0182
Closes-Bug: #1604005

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 17:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/c0d44bf62d8d0227aa52bc939691b7b6634625da', 'message': "Skip pingtest cleanup

We're spending around 2 minutes per run cleaning up the pingtest
resources in an environment that will be deleted immediately
afterwards.  While there's some small chance of this finding a bug
in the overcloud services, we're deploying a very simple Heat stack
so IMHO the slim chances of this finding a bug are not worth the
time it's taking.

Change-Id: I9b39bb6070baa956db283f5a7691385173290e6d
"}]
commit_message:
Skip pingtest cleanup

We're spending around 2 minutes per run cleaning up the pingtest
resources in an environment that will be deleted immediately
afterwards.  While there's some small chance of this finding a bug
in the overcloud services, we're deploying a very simple Heat stack
so IMHO the slim chances of this finding a bug are not worth the
time it's taking.

Change-Id: I9b39bb6070baa956db283f5a7691385173290e6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/70/345570/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVERCLOUD_PINGTEST_OLD_HEATCLIENT=0 $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/tripleo.sh --overcloud-pingtest --skip-pingtest-cleanup

commit_message:
Add dependency on node group template for cluster template

Add autorequire for cluster_template on node_group_template, because
node_group_template must be created before cluster_template every time.

Change-Id: I699cfec1df77a08ef487143f12e31033c5e2eb54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/79/345979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should autorequire sahara-api service' do it 'should autorequire sahara_node_group_template' do catalog = Puppet::Resource::Catalog.new sahara_node_group_template = Puppet::Type.type(:sahara_node_group_template).new({ :name => 'test_type', :plugin => 'plugin', :plugin_version => 'version', :flavor => 'flavor', :node_processes => [ 'process1', 'process2' ] }) sahara_cluster_template = Puppet::Type.type(:sahara_cluster_template).new({ :name => 'test_cluster_type', :node_groups => [ 'test_type:1' ] }) catalog.add_resource sahara_node_group_template, sahara_cluster_template dependency = sahara_cluster_template.autorequire expect(dependency.size).to eq(1) expect(dependency[0].target).to eq(sahara_cluster_template) expect(dependency[0].source).to eq(sahara_node_group_template) end

commit_message:
change mistral-extra release model to none

The mistral-extra repo is being deprecated or split up, so change its
release model to avoid validation errors in the releases repository.

Change-Id: I52d7f5d4a15c304850df4ee2445a1a29321c1989
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[glossary] fixed a grammatical mistake

There is a grammatical mistake in the term of "DNS" in Glossary of
OpenStack End User Guide:
  "Associates a human-friendly names to IP addresses."
An adjective pair added:
  "Associates human-friendly, domain names to IP addresses."
Thank Darren Chan and Joseph Robinson for the suggestions.

Closes-Bug: #1605210
Change-Id: I94f2b81719a74d8c046f6a32225ae557027500d9

Fix service & package names for 16.04

Change package name for vnc proxy for UCA Newton.

commit_message:
Handle empty list of introspected nodes

It seems that if there are no nodes to introspect, the value we get
is an empty list instead of an empty dict. Which is not what we
expect. So this CR fixes that.

Change-Id: I72edd4633d32119eb5f39fb45f8e40ee715eb888
Closes-Bug: #1604371

commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily disable the tag-releases job"

This is dependent on having appropriate Gerrit credentials for an
account in the Release Managers group so that it can push tags
successfully. The dependency below adds that.

This reverts commit cbdb00865dc653275243273cf2949e0c53c8a88b.

Change-Id: I7db1625e85bce5609e4ec2a39e78abb9cd59fa9d
Depends-On: Ibf203b71226a672f707e87f22cbf4990b2ebb003

commit_message:
Make more-less js get dynamic-ui form description trim space

Now the more-less js get dynamic-ui form description with spaces,
So the length is not the exactly length of the description.
This patch trim the description space.

Change-Id: I659ab1d60cb96a261ca9d7081888a4c6a587a252
Closes-Bug: #1594792
(cherry picked from commit 978f0ed4439b9516cf80c47f914764ae8d035b3a)

commit_message:
Disable telemetry configuration for all services

The deployment of all telemetry services was disabled in
https://review.openstack.org/344345 - but all services
being configured to use them which is causing build
failures.

This patch ensures that it's all completely disabled.

Change-Id: I6b4858baf25410d18e3019ae306f0dbef483218e

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/17/344617/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $(which systemctl) ]]; then systemctl stop etcd mkdir -p /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%STATE%%/new/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%CLUSTER_CONFIG%%/$1=http:\/\/$2:7001/g" environ/etcd echo 'INITIAL_CLUSTER_TOKEN="--initial-cluster-token new-token"' >> environ/etcd cp -f environ/etcd /etc/default/ cp -f systemd/etcd.service /etc/systemd/system/ systemctl daemon-reload systemctl enable etcd systemctl start etcd else service etcd stop mkdir /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" default_scripts/etcd-master sed -i.bak "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" default_scripts/etcd-master cp -f default_scripts/etcd-master /etc/default/etcd cp init_conf/etcd.conf /etc/init/ chmod +x initd_scripts/* cp initd_scripts/etcd /etc/init.d/ service etcd start fi sleep 5
deleted_lines: service etcd stop mkdir /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bkp "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" default_scripts/etcd-master sed -i.bkp "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" default_scripts/etcd-master cp -f default_scripts/etcd-master /etc/default/etcd cp init_conf/etcd.conf /etc/init/ chmod +x initd_scripts/* cp initd_scripts/etcd /etc/init.d/ service etcd start sleep 10

commit_message:
[K8s] Update scripts with etcd and flannel configuration

This patch adds tuning of existing scripts related to
updating etcd binaries from 2.0.13 to 2.2.5

Change-Id: I33eac5abe96449a2a35f7305632b68fd20960f5c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/05/344605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $(which systemctl) ]]; then systemctl stop etcd mkdir -p /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%STATE%%/new/g" environ/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%CLUSTER_CONFIG%%/$1=http:\/\/$2:7001/g" environ/etcd echo 'INITIAL_CLUSTER_TOKEN="--initial-cluster-token new-token"' >> environ/etcd cp -f environ/etcd /etc/default/ cp -f systemd/etcd.service /etc/systemd/system/ systemctl daemon-reload systemctl enable etcd systemctl start etcd else service etcd stop mkdir /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bak "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" default_scripts/etcd-master sed -i.bak "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" default_scripts/etcd-master cp -f default_scripts/etcd-master /etc/default/etcd cp init_conf/etcd.conf /etc/init/ chmod +x initd_scripts/* cp initd_scripts/etcd /etc/init.d/ service etcd start fi sleep 5
deleted_lines: service etcd stop mkdir /var/lib/etcd sed -i.bkp "s/%%NAME%%/$1/g" default_scripts/etcd-master sed -i.bkp "s/%%IP%%/$2/g" default_scripts/etcd-master cp -f default_scripts/etcd-master /etc/default/etcd cp init_conf/etcd.conf /etc/init/ chmod +x initd_scripts/* cp initd_scripts/etcd /etc/init.d/ service etcd start sleep 10

commit_message:
[K8s] Updating DIB elements and fix k8s application

 * DIB element is updated to the latest k8s version - 1.3.0
 * K8s application is fixed according to the new k8s version:

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 13:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Classes/KubernetesGatewayNode.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps/commit/d1bcb2895bd1ef494aa0c07258b6c384daebd1cf', 'message': '[k8s] Save gateway node ip before its release for proper reporting

During scaling gateways down, reporter was trying to get ip of the
instance which was already released and that caused index error.
This patch saves this ip for report before releasing resourses.

Change-Id: I9310a423b1ad8c488c1cc7400844ae5d8767879c
Closes-bug: #1590728
(cherry picked from commit 3c393ba7c6e63c93018ffa7f422ee9a7ceb5fbce)
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Save gateway node ip before its release for proper reporting

During scaling gateways down, reporter was trying to get ip of the
instance which was already released and that caused index error.
This patch saves this ip for report before releasing resourses.

Change-Id: I9310a423b1ad8c488c1cc7400844ae5d8767879c
Closes-bug: #1590728
(cherry picked from commit 3c393ba7c6e63c93018ffa7f422ee9a7ceb5fbce)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/53/344853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - $ip: $.getIp(true) - $._environment.reporter.report($this, 'Gateway {0} at {1} was deleted'.format($.instance.name, $ip))

subject: Use more specific asserts in functional tests

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 12:07:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fae1f0b24462bffee09c9ab7b5e095ea15da02c6', 'message': 'Use more specific aserts in functional tests

e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in functional tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I80ec96e0b729bef38213a6be4ff4b6eb65c7612d

subject: use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 08:20:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator/commit/b712eb7054b315f2e2208f688499e4d55c774528', 'message': 'WIP - Use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients

WIP: see last paragraph for an explanation.

The parser should not rely on the OS_* environment variables for
authentication, as it will fail with more complex setups, when using
the "clouds.yaml" configuration file or when being called through osc
with arguments instead of environment variables.

Moreover, the client should not use "requests" directly to do GETs to
access the nova flavors and glance images, but it should use the
existing clients.

When used through the python-openstackclient it is possible to force the
client to request authentication. The authentication will be handled by
the client, so that the parser does not need to worry about it (so that
authentication plugins can be used). Then, the existing authentication
session can be reused for all the client interaction with OpenStack to
fetch the flavor and images information.

Note: this change breaks the way "shell.py" is doing things. Adapting
"shell.py" to use keystoneauth is a not straightforward work and it will
require more changes, mainly because it is not using a parser for
checking the arguments. I do not know if it is worth to maintain and
improve "shell.py" or just maintain the "osc" integration.

Change-Id: I9f65e7d46686c37bb44ef18756ebd295ee4961de
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-23 11:50:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator/commit/41c585156dfe096b96a62e30209e64e6ce23e593', 'message': 'use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients

commit_message:
use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients

The parser should not rely on the OS_* environment variables for
authentication, as it will fail with more complex setups, when using the
"clouds.yaml" configuration file or when being called through osc with
arguments instead of environment variables.

Moreover, the client should not use "requests" directly to do GETs to
access the nova flavors and glance images, but it should use the
existing clients.

When used through the python-openstackclient it is possible to force the
client to request authentication. The authentication will be handled by
the client, so that the parser does not need to worry about it (so that
authentication plugins can be used). Then, the existing authentication
session can be reused for all the client interaction with OpenStack to
fetch the flavor and images information.

Change-Id: I9f65e7d46686c37bb44ef18756ebd295ee4961de

commit_message:
Provide pci whitelist for the DPDK_OPTIONS for ovs

To use DPDK, nics has to be bind with DPDK drivers. Once
binded, the nics will not be listed in the kernel commands.
We have to update the list of PCI address of the nics which
are bound to the DPDK drivers with openvswtich DPDK_OPTIONS
as whitelist. For which, the list of PCI address of the
nics which are bound to the given DPDK drivers are listed
via a custom facter. This whitelist is fed as input to the
DPDK_OPTIONS.

Co-Authored-By: Jaganathan Palanisamy <jpalanis@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I4fbca23e07468ee58dfce10a6deaf2f25da654c7

added_lines: $driver_type = 'vfio-pci', if $driver_type { $pci_list = inline_template('<%= Facter.value("pci_address_driver_#@driver_type") %>') unless empty($pci_list) { $white_list = inline_template('-w <%= @pci_list.gsub(",", " -w ") %>') } } $options = "DPDK_OPTIONS = \"-l ${core_list} -n ${memory_channels} ${socket_string} ${white_list}\""

commit_message:
Add a command prompt for action bind

Change-Id: I4f5932c49c06066025b3dcfa4b2f2e747045a5f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/32/346032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import socket import sys from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from oslo_utils import importutils from neutron.common import config as common_config from dragonflow.common import common_params from dragonflow.common import exceptions as df_exceptions cfg.CONF.register_opts(common_params.df_opts, 'df') db_tables = ['lport', 'lswitch', 'lrouter', 'chassis', 'secgroup', 'tunnel_key', 'floatingip', 'publisher'] usage_str = "The following commands are supported:
" \ "1) df-db ls - print all the db tables 
" \ "2) df-db ls <table_name> - print all the keys for specific table 
" \ "3) df-db get <table_name> <key> - print value for specific key
" \ "4) df-db dump - dump all tables
" \ "5) df-db bind <port id> - bind a port to localhost
" \ "6) df-db clean - clean up all keys
" \ "7) df-db rm <table name> <key> - remove the specified db record
" \ "8) df-db init - initialize all tables
" \ "9) df-db dropall - drop all tables
" def print_tables(): print(' ') print('DB Tables') print('----------') for table in db_tables: print table print(' ') def print_table(db_driver, table): try: keys = db_driver.get_all_keys(table) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: keys = [] print(' ') print('Keys for table ' + table) print('------------------------------------------------------------') for key in keys: print key print(' ') def print_whole_table(db_driver, table): try: keys = db_driver.get_all_keys(table) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: print('Table not found: ' + table) return print(' ') print('------------------------------------------------------------') print('Table = ' + table) print('------------------------------------------------------------') for key in keys: value = db_driver.get_key(table, key) if value: print ('Key = ' + key + ' , Value = ' + value) print(' ') def print_key(db_driver, table, key): try: value = db_driver.get_key(table, key) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: print('Key not found: ' + table) return print(' ') print('Table = ' + table + ' , Key = ' + key) print('------------------------------------------------------------') print value print(' ') def bind_port_to_localhost(db_driver, port_id): lport_str = db_driver.get_key('lport', port_id) lport = jsonutils.loads(lport_str) chassis_name = socket.gethostname() lport['chassis'] = chassis_name lport_json = jsonutils.dumps(lport) db_driver.set_key('lport', port_id, lport_json) def clean_whole_table(db_driver, table): try: keys = db_driver.get_all_keys(table) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: print('Table not found: ' + table) return for key in keys: db_driver.delete_key(table, key) def drop_table(db_driver, table): try: db_driver.delete_table(table) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: print('Table not found: ' + table) def create_table(db_driver, table): db_driver.create_table(table) print('Table %s is created.' % table) def remove_record(db_driver, table, key): try: db_driver.delete_key(table, key) except df_exceptions.DBKeyNotFound: print('Key %s is not found in table %s.' % (key, table)) def main(): if len(sys.argv) < 2: print usage_str return common_config.init(['--config-file', '/etc/neutron/neutron.conf']) db_driver_class = importutils.import_class(cfg.CONF.df.nb_db_class) db_driver = db_driver_class() db_driver.initialize(db_ip=cfg.CONF.df.remote_db_ip, db_port=cfg.CONF.df.remote_db_port, config=cfg.CONF.df) action = sys.argv[1] if action == 'ls': if len(sys.argv) == 2: print_tables() return table = sys.argv[2] if table not in db_tables: print "<table> must be one of the following:" print db_tables return print_table(db_driver, table) return if action == 'get': if len(sys.argv) < 4: print "must supply a key" print usage_str return table = sys.argv[2] if table not in db_tables: print "<table> must be one of the following:" print db_tables return key = sys.argv[3] print_key(db_driver, table, key) return if action == 'dump': for table in db_tables: print_whole_table(db_driver, table) return if action == 'bind': port_id = sys.argv[2] bind_port_to_localhost(db_driver, port_id) return if action == 'clean': for table in db_tables: clean_whole_table(db_driver, table) return if action == 'init': for table in db_tables: create_table(db_driver, table) return if action == 'dropall': for table in db_tables: drop_table(db_driver, table) return if action == 'rm': if len(sys.argv) < 4: print "must supply a key" print usage_str return table = sys.argv[2] if table not in db_tables: print "<table> must be one of the following: %s" % db_tables return key = sys.argv[3] remove_record(db_driver, table, key) return print usage_str if __name__ == "__main__": main()

commit_message:
Huawei: Support reporting disk type of pool

Adding support for reporting disk type of pool in huawei cinder
driver. When creating volume we can specify the disk type of the
pool we want to use ssd/sas/nl_sas/mix, cinder driver will report
the disk type of the pools.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint huawei-pool-disktype-support
Change-Id: I10bbcf18ba04bdbb61a88e23cf4ec88c05b2c38d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/63/324163/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: info['TIER0CAPACITY'] = pool['TIER0CAPACITY'] info['TIER1CAPACITY'] = pool['TIER1CAPACITY'] info['TIER2CAPACITY'] = pool['TIER2CAPACITY'] def _get_disk_type(self, pool_name, result): """Get disk type of the pool.""" pool_info = self.get_pool_info(pool_name, result) if not pool_info: return None pool_disk = [] if pool_info['TIER0CAPACITY'] != '0': pool_disk.append('ssd') if pool_info['TIER1CAPACITY'] != '0': pool_disk.append('sas') if pool_info['TIER2CAPACITY'] != '0': pool_disk.append('nl_sas') if len(pool_disk) > 1: pool_disk = ['mix'] return pool_disk[0] if pool_disk else None disk_type = self._get_disk_type(pool_name, result) if disk_type: pool['disk_type'] = disk_type

subject: [kubernetes] Create actions to recreate pods and restart containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 12:51:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps/commit/815f52e3e08d1ea38428b34810cc2d9fe801e021', 'message': "[kubernetes] Create action to restart pods

This patch adds action to KubernetesPod class which allows to restart a pod.
At first it deletes existing pod. If replication controller is present, it recreates
pod automatically. If it's not, pod is recreated manually.

commit_message:
[kubernetes] Create actions to recreate pods and restart containers

This patch adds actions to KubernetesPod class which allow to
recreate a pod (delete it and create new one) and to restart docker
containers on minion nodes.

Change-Id: Ia03b27d72662700fb302960adba9dae20203b597
Closes-bug: #1466359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-apps refs/changes/13/308313/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: restartPod: Usage: Action Body: - $._environment.reporter.report($this, 'Restarting Pod') - $.kubernetesCluster.deletePods(dict(id => $._getPodName())) - If: $.replicas = 0 Then: - $._loadCurrentPodDefinition() - $.kubernetesCluster.createPod(definition => $._podDefinition, isNew => true)

commit_message:
Add 'service_name' to composable services

This patch adds a new service_name section to each composable
service. We now have an explicit unit test check to ensure that
service_name exists in tools/yaml-validate.py.

This patch also wires service_names into hieradata on each
of the roles so that tools can access the deployed services locally
during deployment and upgrades.

Change-Id: I60861c5aa760534db3e314bba16a13b90ea72f0c

commit_message:
Could not invoke static methods from Python

Static method were handled incorrectly when
called from Python because of incorrect
method receiver.

Change-Id: Id7ef2bc0c74154bd3ac6ef7dcf8fa807a4be757b
Closes-Bug: #1596613
(cherry picked from commit 75bded129e66a75cf6d760ce825571cc3a2dc45d)

commit_message:
Patch adds yum logging to the updates code

Previously fix was added to the decorator.
This one will cover updates section

Change-Id: I79495b19d341023a5f5067379d3ead2a5b8d3075
Related-Bug:1585194
(cherry picked from commit 8cd2007a1904e969976cce6d8abca84386d127f5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/70/345970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_command = 'yum clean expire-cache && ' \ 'yum update -y 2>>/var/log/yum-update-error.log' logger.info('Performing yum clean and update commands') update_result = self.ssh_manager.execute_on_remote( cmd=update_command, err_msg='Packages update failed, inspect logs for details') logger.info('Packages were updated successfully') match_updated_count = re.search(r'Upgrade\s+(\d+)\s+Package', update_result['stdout_str']) # In case of package replacement, the new one is marked as # installed and the old one as removed match_installed_count = re.search(r'Install\s+(\d+)\s+Package', update_result['stdout_str']) match_complete_message = re.search(r'Complete!', update_result['stdout_str']) match_no_updates = re.search("No Packages marked for Update", update_result['stdout_str']) if match_no_updates or not match_complete_message \ or not (match_updated_count or match_installed_count): updates_count = 0 if match_updated_count: updates_count += int(match_updated_count.group(1)) if match_installed_count: updates_count += int(match_installed_count.group(1)) logger.info('{0} package(s) were updated'.format(updates_count))
deleted_lines: update_command = 'yum clean expire-cache; yum update -y' update_result = self.ssh_manager.execute( cmd=update_command ) logger.info('Result of "{1}" command on master node: ' '{0}'.format(update_result, update_command)) assert_equal(int(update_result['exit_code']), 0, 'Packages update failed, ' 'inspect logs for details') for str_line in update_result['stdout']: match_updated_count = re.search("Upgrade(?:\s*)(\d+).*Package", str_line) if match_updated_count: updates_count = match_updated_count.group(1) match_complete_message = re.search("(Complete!)", str_line) match_no_updates = re.search("No Packages marked for Update", str_line) if (not match_updated_count or match_no_updates)\ and not match_complete_message: logger.info('{0} packet(s) were updated'.format(updates_count))

deleted_lines: update_command = 'yum clean expire-cache; yum update -y' update_result = self.ssh_manager.execute( cmd=update_command ) logger.info('Result of "{1}" command on master node: ' '{0}'.format(update_result, update_command)) assert_equal(int(update_result['exit_code']), 0, 'Packages update failed, ' 'inspect logs for details') for str_line in update_result['stdout']: match_updated_count = re.search("Upgrade(?:\s*)(\d+).*Package", str_line) if match_updated_count: updates_count = match_updated_count.group(1) match_complete_message = re.search("(Complete!)", str_line) match_no_updates = re.search("No Packages marked for Update", str_line) if (not match_updated_count or match_no_updates)\ and not match_complete_message: logger.info('{0} packet(s) were updated'.format(updates_count))

commit_message:
Make more-less js get dynamic-ui form description trim space

Now the more-less js get dynamic-ui form description with spaces,
So the length is not the exactly length of the description.
This patch trim the description space.

Change-Id: I659ab1d60cb96a261ca9d7081888a4c6a587a252
Closes-Bug: #1594792

commit_message:
Extract `etc` files from openstack packages

Extract the required files from openstack packages instead of installing
the entire set of packages. This cuts the image size by ~500MB.

Change-Id: Id5a2519d5471c25b44c3ad7ce441d9bae3cae651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/51/345051/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(flaper87): openstack packages # We need these packages just to install the config files. # Instead of installing the entire package, we'll extract the # config files from the RPM and put them in place. This step will # save us ~500 MB in the final size of the image. yum install -y --downloadonly --downloaddir=/tmp/packages \ openstack-ceilometer-compute \ python-nova \ openstack-nova-common \ openstack-neutron \ libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter \ libvirt-daemon-kvm \ openstack-nova-compute \ openstack-neutron-ml2 \ openstack-neutron-openvswitch CUR=`pwd` cd /tmp/packages for f in $(ls openstack-*.rpm); do rpm2cpio $f | cpio -ivd ./etc/* if [ -d 'etc' ]; then cp -r etc/* /etc rm -Rf etc fi done cd $CUR && rm -Rf /tmp/packages
deleted_lines: # openstack packages yum install -y \ openstack-ceilometer-compute \ python-nova \ openstack-nova-common \ openstack-neutron \ libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter \ libvirt-daemon-kvm \ openstack-nova-compute \ openstack-neutron-ml2 \ openstack-neutron-openvswitch
